cheadline: 金正恩向世界秀肌肉
clongleadbody: 从导弹试验到涉嫌杀害兄弟，朝鲜的事态变化反映出平壤政权的好斗性质，这也为中美解决朝鲜问题提供了动力。
cbody:
金正男(Kim Jong Nam)到早了，他要乘坐的飞往澳门的航班还要两个小时才起飞。这位朝鲜统治政权金家王朝曾经的继承人，孤身一人缓步行走在吉隆坡国际机场宽敞的廉价航班候机楼里。

他看上去体态臃肿，不修边幅，没人会猜到他算得上皇室血脉。但他正被监视着，且马上就要被刺杀，而这一消息将震惊全球。

两名年轻女子在航站楼里偷偷跟着他，一个穿着印有“LOL”字母的T恤。四名男性同谋远远地观察着事态进展。

当46岁的金正男——朝鲜领导人金正恩(Kim Jong Un)同父异母的长兄——止步在一台自助值机机器时，两名女子发动了袭击。

据警方报告，她们从金正男背后靠近他，一名女子猛地扭过他的头，向他脸上喷洒液体。另一名女子同时扑过去，在他的眼睛、鼻子和嘴部用力捂上一块布，时间有10秒钟左右。

头晕目眩的金正男跌跌撞撞地在机场里寻求救助，明显呈现中毒状况，几分钟后在被紧急送往医院途中身亡。

外界普遍认为这位本来可能的接班人死于朝鲜特工之手，他的死讯被封锁了近两天，才于上周二在全球媒体迅速传播。新闻出来后，其内在信息不言而喻：朝鲜不会忍受对其存在的任何挑战——无论是事实还是想象；没有任何边界是神圣不可侵犯的——无论是家族的还是地理的。

正值各国再次试图解决平壤造成的危机之际，这一事件就朝鲜政权的性质及其最根深蒂固的意图，给世人上了有用的一课。

金正男遇刺事件提出了一个警告，即想要处理朝鲜核武器和弹道导弹计划，必须考虑一个关键因素：33岁的金正恩元帅的生存本能。一名美国官员曾将朝鲜描述为“糟糕选择之地”。

在离开椭圆形办公室之前，美国总统巴拉克•奥巴马(Barack Obama)对即将上任的唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)表示，朝鲜将成为他最紧迫的外交政策挑战。

2016年朝鲜进行了两次核试验，还试射了20多枚高技术含量中短程弹道导弹，重新杀回地缘政治引爆点榜单。在奥巴马与古巴和伊朗签署协议之后，朝鲜拒不就范，成了流氓国家的典范，而且迅速吸引了特朗普的注意。

金正恩在新年致辞中宣布，他的政权拥有远程导弹，随时可以打击到美国。虽然朝鲜从未证明这一能力，但上述言论足以引发美国新任总统的Twitter快攻，特朗普发誓这种事“不会发生”。

前排右为童年时代的金正男，前排左为他的父亲金正日

上上周日特朗普再遭考验，这一次更加具有爆炸性：朝鲜向日本海试射了一枚中程弹道导弹。

首尔延世大学(Yonsei University)朝鲜专家奉英植(Bong Young-shik)表示，“这是一条精心策划的、多层次的信息”，为的是试探特朗普。

奉英植认为，金正恩是想知道特朗普会作何反应，所以没有试射远程导弹，完全关闭谈判大门。

特朗普的首次公开回应有所克制，导弹发射时特朗普正在他的佛罗里达州海滩庄园招待日本首相安倍晋三(Shinzo Abe)。在与安倍的联合声明中，特朗普发誓支持他的“伟大盟友”日本。

生存本能

焦点现在转向了特朗普将如何更全面地应对朝鲜问题，以及他将如何吸引中国加入，人们普遍认为中国是关键的权力中间人。有越来越多的共识认为对朝鲜的长期策略——以严格制裁实施经济和外交隔离——没有起到作用。

延世大学教授鲁乐汉(John Delury)近期在《外交政策》(Foreign Policy)上发文表示：“如果美国真正希望在朝鲜半岛实现和平，就应停止想方设法地扼杀朝鲜经济，破坏金正恩政权，而要开始想办法增加平壤方面的安全感。”

“这听起来可能违反直觉，但请考虑一点，朝鲜只有不再担心自己被摧毁，才会开始关注其国内繁荣，而不是自卫。”

对许多人来说，对朝制裁，加上美韩在半岛的常规军演，以及惹怒北京的导弹防御系统部署计划，只会强化金正恩的生存本能，推动他向核武器道路继续前进。

首尔的政策制定者和专家表示，朝鲜无核化的前景已经失败——美国前国家情报总监(DNI)詹姆斯•克拉珀(James Clapper)在去年底的一次演讲中呼应了这个观点。这些武器，就像金正男被谋杀一样，是这位朝鲜领导人的安全、自由和权威的保证。

一个更可行的选择是延缓其核武器开发，西江大学(Sogang University)政治学教授、韩国政府顾问金宰春(Kim Jae-chun)说。“无核化是不可能的。然而，只要美国不试图拆除其核武器，朝鲜就很有可能宣布暂停其核计划。需要采取积极的外交行动。”

像大多数战略家一样，金宰春教授毫不犹豫地否定了对朝鲜核设施发起预防性军事打击的想法。这种打击必然会失败，他说，因为大多数设施都隐藏在地下。这也将导致距离边界仅60公里的首尔遭到灾难性的报复攻击。在1990年代，美国总统比尔•克林顿(Bill Clinton)曾考虑过这个选项，但报复攻击会给韩国带来约100万伤亡，让他放弃了这一想法。

然而，并非各个方面都支持与平壤方面接触，韩国保守集团对此表示强烈反对。对他们来说，无核化是关键的第一步。

“当朝鲜仍然朝着核武器迈进时，缓和紧张是一句假话……这只是透支明天的和平。这使明天变得更危险，”韩国前对朝主要谈判代表千英宇(Chun Yung-woo)说。

他表示，国际社会必须加强制裁，让金正恩政权别无选择，只能达成协议。他的提议在美国获得一定的支持。最近，包括得克萨斯州参议员特德•克鲁兹(Ted Cruz)在内的一群共和党人，敦促财政部加大对朝鲜的财政压力。

中国的困局

在北京一片树木茂密的区域，朝鲜驻华大使馆占据着一块很大的城市街区。这些低矮、破旧的建筑与北京中央商务区的摩天大楼并列在一起。

这种对比让人想起这对共产主义邻国之间在发展上的巨大差距——中国实行了近40年的改革开放，而朝鲜的自给自足却失败了。

对中国国家主席习近平来说，朝鲜是一个贫穷、令人尴尬的邻国。两位强人从来没有见过面，尽管两个人都在约五年前掌权。

由于对平壤方面拒绝放弃核试验计划感到愤怒，北京方面已加入了联合国越来越强硬的对朝制裁。但中国不愿对朝鲜施加太大压力。

尽管金正恩是一个棘手的盟友，但对中国而言，现状好于朝鲜政权崩溃、难民流入中国东北、韩国在美军帮助下收拾残局的前景。

这些现实在很大程度上是中国几十年来对朝态度的基础。然而，如果查实金正恩的哥哥确是被朝鲜特工所杀，那么中国对朝鲜的耐心将会受到前所未有的考验。

韩国情报部门表示，金正男及其家人住在中国唯一可以合法经营赌场的澳门，受到中国政府的保护。

多年来，金正男在朝鲜宣传中国式的经济改革，并被认为是被北京方面作为替代者庇护起来，以防金正恩太难打交道。

“这次暗杀使朝鲜半岛局势变得更加危险，”位于北京的中共中央党校的教授张连贵说。

从弹道导弹试验到涉嫌残杀兄弟，上周的事态变化清楚地反映了平壤政权的好斗性质。

这也为美国和中国提供了解决朝鲜问题的直接动力。三国之间的合作是至关重要的，但合作总是被互不信任和酝酿中的紧张关系破坏。

韩国前谈判代表千英宇认为，如果特朗普集中精力与中国达成大协议，那么他就有可能成功地安抚平壤。

但是，由于这位美国领导人正忙着在国内救火，目前还不清楚这位自封的交易大师能否达成他生命中最重大的交易。

译者/何黎
eheadline: North Korea’s young marshal flexes his muscle
ebody:
Kim Jong Nam arrived early. With two hours until his flight home to Macau, the one-time heir to North Korea’s ruling Kim dynasty ambled unaccompanied through the spacious budget terminal of Kuala Lumpur international airport.

A portly, unkempt figure, few would have guessed his almost royal lineage. But he was being watched, and his imminent assassination would send shockwaves around the world.

Two young women, one wearing a T-shirt bearing the initials LOL, stalked him through the terminal. A group of four male conspirators monitored events from a distance.

When the 46-year-old Kim — a half brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un — stopped at a self check-in kiosk, the women struck.

Approaching from behind, one jerked back his head and, according to police accounts, sprayed liquid in his face. The other simultaneously pounced, pressing a rag over his eyes, nose and mouth for about 10 seconds.

Dizzy and disoriented, Kim stumbled through the airport looking for assistance, only to succumb to the apparent poisoning minutes later as he was rushed to hospital.

The death of the would-be leader, widely believed to be at the hands of North Korean agents, was kept under wraps for almost two days before exploding across global media on Tuesday. When it did, the message was unmistakable: North Korea will brook no challenge, real or imagined, to its existence. No boundary, whether familial or geographic, was sacred.

At a time when nations are again attempting to address the dangers posed by Pyongyang, the incident serves as a salutary lesson on the nature of the regime and its most deeply held intentions.

It is a warning that efforts to tackle the nuclear and ballistic weapons programmes of North Korea — once described by a US official as the “land of lousy options” — hinge on a key factor: the survival instinct of the 33-year-old marshal Kim Jong Un.

Before departing the Oval Office, US President Barack Obama informed incoming leader Donald Trump that North Korea would represent his most pressing foreign policy challenge.

The country had stormed back up the list of potential geopolitical flashpoints in 2016 after testing two nuclear devices and more than 20 sophisticated short- and medium-range ballistic missiles. After Mr Obama brokered agreements with Cuba and Iran, North Korea stood apart as a glaring example of a rogue nation refusing to come to heel. And it moved quickly to grab Mr Trump’s attention.

In a New Year’s address, Mr Kim announced his regime had long-range missiles capable of hitting the US whenever it chooses. The country had never demonstrated such capabilities, but the rhetoric was enough to elicit a quick-fire tweet from the new US president, who vowed it “won’t happen”.

Mr Trump was tested again last Sunday, this time in a more explosive manner, when Pyongyang launched an advanced mid-range rocket into the Sea of Japan.

“This was a carefully layered message” to gauge Trump, says Bong Youngshik, a North Korea expert at Yonsei University in Seoul.

Mr Kim wanted to learn how Mr Trump would react, without completely shutting the door on negotiations by launching a long-range missile, according to Mr Bong.

The initial public response of Mr Trump, who at the time of the launch was hosting Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe at his Florida beach estate, was restrained. In a joint statement with Mr Abe, he vowed to support his “great ally” Japan.

Survival instinct

The focus has now shifted to how Mr Trump will respond to North Korea more broadly and how he will engage China, widely viewed as the crucial powerbroker. There is a growing consensus that the longstanding approach to North Korea — economic and diplomatic isolation enforced by rigid sanctions — is not working.

“If the US really hopes to achieve peace on the Korean peninsula, it should stop looking for ways to stifle North Korea’s economy and undermine Kim Jong Un’s regime and start finding ways to make Pyongyang feel more secure,” wrote John Delury, a professor at Yonsei University, in a recent Foreign Affairs article.

“This might sound counterintuitive. But consider this: North Korea will start focusing on its prosperity instead of its self-preservation only once it no longer has to worry about its own destruction.”

For many, the sanctions, combined with the regular US-South Korea armed drills on the peninsula and the planned deployment of a missile shield that has angered Beijing, only strengthen Mr Kim’s survival instinct and pushes him further down the path towards nuclear armament.

According to policymakers and experts in Seoul, the prospect of de-nuclearisation in North Korea is already a lost cause — a notion echoed by James Clapper, the former US director of national intelligence, in a speech late last year. The weapons, much like the murder of Kim Jong Nam, act as a guarantee of the North Korean leader’s safety, liberty and authority.

A more viable option is a moratorium on their development, says Kim Jaechun, a professor of political science at Sogang University and adviser to the Seoul government. “De-nuclearisation is not possible. However, as long as the US doesn’t try to dismantle its nuclear weapons, it is quite possible for North Korea to declare a moratorium on its nuclear programme. Proactive diplomacy is needed.”

Prof Kim, like most strategists, is quick to dismiss the idea of a preventive military strike on Pyongyang’s nuclear facilities. Such an attack would inevitably fail, he says, because most facilities are hidden underground. It would also result in catastrophic retaliatory strikes on Seoul, just 60km from the border. In the 1990s, US President Bill Clinton considered the option, only to be dissuaded by estimates of 1m South Korean casualties from such an attack.

However, engagement with Pyongyang is not favoured by all and is bitterly opposed by conservative South Korean groups. For them, de-nuclearisation is the crucial first step.

“Lower tensions while North Korea is still moving towards nukes is a deception . . . It is just borrowing tomorrow’s peace. It makes tomorrow more dangerous,” says Chun Yung-woo, a former leading South Korean negotiator with Pyongyang.

He says the international community must ratchet up sanctions to the point where the Kim regime faces no alternative but to make a deal. His proposal has some support in the US. On Thursday, a group of Republicans, including the Texas senator Ted Cruz, urged the Treasury to ramp up financial pressure on North Korea.

China’s dilemma

In a leafy Beijing district, North Korea’s embassy sprawls across a large city block. Its squat, shabby buildings are juxtaposed against the skyscrapers of the capital’s central business district.

The contrast is a stark reminder of the developmental gulf that separates the communist neighbours after almost 40 years of reform and opening in China, and failed autarky in North Korea.

For Chinese President Xi Jinping, North Korea is a needy, embarrassing neighbour. The two strongmen have never met, despite both assuming power about five years ago.

Angered by Pyongyang’s refusal to abandon its nuclear testing programme, Beijing has signed up to increasingly tough UN sanctions. But it is reluctant to apply too much pressure.

As trying an ally as Mr Kim is, the status quo for China beats the prospect of a collapse of the regime, refugees streaming into northeastern China and Seoul picking up the pieces with the help of the US military.

These realities have underpinned much of China’s approach to North Korea for decades. However, if it is confirmed that Mr Kim’s elder brother was murdered by North Korean agents, Beijing’s patience with Pyongyang will be tested like never before.

A resident of the gambling enclave of Macau, Kim Jong Nam and his family enjoyed the protection of the Chinese government, according to South Korean intelligence.

For years he preached Chinese-style economic reforms in North Korea and was thought to have been harboured by Beijing as a potential alternative should Mr Kim become too much to deal with.

“The assassination has made the situation on the Korean peninsula even more dangerous,” says Zhang Liangui, a professor at the Chinese Communist party’s Central Party School in Beijing.

From the ballistic missile test to suspected fratricide, the events of the past week reflect clearly on the aggressive nature of the regime in Pyongyang.

They also provide an immediate impetus for Washington and Beijing to address the North Korean question. Co-operation between the three capitals is crucial, yet is constantly undercut by mistrust and simmering tensions.

For Mr Chun, the former South Korean negotiator, if Mr Trump focuses his energy on striking a grand bargain with Beijing he can succeed in pacifying Pyongyang.

But with the US leader busy putting out fires at home, it is unclear whether the self-professed master dealmaker can seal the biggest one of his life.

cheadline: 西方面对威权主义浪潮
clongleadbody: 拉赫曼：民主化进程似乎已经逆转，一股发端于西方老牌民主国家之外的威权主义浪潮已经蔓延至美国和欧洲。
cbody:
柏林墙(Berlin Wall)倒塌后，全球掀起了一股“民主化浪潮”。政治自由思想从西欧和美国的传统堡垒中扩散开来——波兰、南非、印度尼西亚等形形色色的国家都转型成为民主国家。

但如今，这一进程似乎已经发生逆转。一股发端于西方老牌民主国家之外的威权主义浪潮已经蔓延至美国和欧洲。

首先显现于俄罗斯、泰国、菲律宾等年轻民主国家的威权主义观念和实践的复兴，已经扩散到了西方政治之中。

波兰、匈牙利两国政府都有威权主义倾向。最戏剧性的一幕是，美国选出了一位将自由媒体视为“敌人”且对司法独立缺乏尊重的总统。

这股威权主义浪潮有可能破坏关于政治如何运作的美好设想。认为西方老牌富裕民主国家的政治与拉美或亚洲的政治存在根本差别的观念，可能需要重新斟酌。认为中产阶级和年轻人将永远是民主制度最坚定支持者的想法，看起来也越发难以站住脚。

去年，在唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)当选前，罗伯特•福阿(Roberto Foa)和雅恰•蒙特(Yascha Mounk)两位学者撰写了一篇引发热议的文章，概述了西方民主价值观的逐渐式微。该文强调了反民主情绪同时在美国和欧洲的兴起。他们最引人注意的观点之一是，如今六分之一的美国人认为“让军队统治”是个好主意，而在1995年，有如此想法的美国人的比例仅为十六分之一。生于上世纪30年代的美国人中，超过70%认为生活在民主社会“至关重要”，而在上世纪80年代出生的美国人中，仅有30%赞同这一观点。在欧洲，对民主制度的信心也出现了相似的下滑——即便不像美国那么明显。福阿和蒙特得出的结论是：“过去30年，在北美和西欧所有老牌民主国家，对议会等政治机构或法院的信任都出现了急剧下滑。”

福阿和蒙特专注的是西方。但在一些曾经是民主化浪潮的象征的国家，“软性威权主义”(soft authoritarianism)的复兴甚至更加明显，比如1986年推翻马科斯(Marcos)政权的菲律宾、1991年结束共产党统治的俄罗斯以及1994年废除种族隔离制度的南非。这三国都保留了民主制度的关键元素，如选举，但都出现了民主准则遭削弱，同时推行个人统治，从而导致腐败盛行。

在俄罗斯，上世纪90年代的经济崩溃和法治缺失为弗拉基米尔•普京(Vladimir Putin)恢复独裁创造了条件。普京为软性威权主义打造了一个样板，这种威权主义结合了民族主义、民粹主义、腐败、打压媒体以及总统与富豪寡头之间的紧密联盟。一些对特朗普主义最明晰的警告都出自加里•卡斯帕罗夫(Garry Kasparov)、玛莎•格森(Masha Gessen)等俄罗斯异见人士，这或许并非偶然。

菲律宾强人总统罗德里戈•杜特尔特(Rodrigo Duterte)完全借用了普京的脚本。他利用非执法人员私自执法的手段令菲律宾自由派人士胆寒，但他赢得了被犯罪和毒品吓怕了的公众的支持。杜特尔特也很受年轻选民欢迎，年轻人对菲律宾建立民主的艰苦历程基本没什么记忆。

同样一幕正威胁着南非。雅各布•祖马(Jacob Zuma)任总统期间，南非腐败现象激增，媒体以及政府的独立分支机构受到越来越大的压力。许多南非自由派人士盼望祖马任期的结束将迎来民主的复兴。但形势有可能朝相反方向发展。标准银行(Standard Bank)资深政治经济学家西蒙•弗里曼特尔(Simon Freemantle)警告称，“南非的特朗普时刻正在酝酿之中”。他指出一些调查显示，南非“生而自由”的一代——生于纳尔逊•曼德拉(Nelson Mandela)1990年获释之后——并不像经历过与种族隔离制度作斗争的人们那样支持民主。在南非，也有越来越多的人支持像特朗普那样驱逐非法移民。

在俄罗斯、菲律宾、南非、甚至美国这些如此迥然不同的国家，导致对民主的支持逐渐降低的共同原因是什么？实际上，对许多选民来说，民主是达到目的的一种手段，其本身并非目的。如果民主制度无法带来就业（如在南非）或安全（如在菲律宾），或者被认为造成了生活水平停滞不前（如在美国），那么一些选民就会被另一种选择威权主义所吸引。在不平等程度日益加剧的背景下，当政治经济体制看起来“被操纵”、偏向内部人时，一国更有可能滑向威权主义。

当然，总会有一些人将政治自由本身视为一种价值观，对人类尊严不可或缺。但为支持言论自由而甘愿坐牢的持不同政见者相对较少。在冷战最后几年担任美国总统的罗纳德•里根(Ronald Reagan)喜欢说“自由是管用的”（freedom works）。遗憾的是，如果普通民众不再相信这一点，有些人就可能不对自由抱希望了。

eheadline: The authoritarian wave reaches the west
ebody:
After the fall of the Berlin Wall, there was a “democratic wave”. Political freedom spread from its traditional bastions in western Europe and the US — and countries as diverse as Poland, South Africa and Indonesia turned democratic.

But now the process seems to have gone into reverse. An authoritarian wave that began outside the established democracies of the west has spread to the US and Europe.

The resurgence of authoritarian attitudes and practices that first manifested itself in young democracies, such as Russia, Thailand and the Philippines, has spread into western politics.

Poland and Hungary have governments with

authoritarian tendencies. The most dramatic development is the election of a US president who regards the free press as “the enemy” and has little respect for an independent judiciary.

This authoritarian wave threatens to undermine comfortable assumptions about how politics works. The belief that the politics of the rich, established democracies of the west are fundamentally different from those of Latin America or Asia may need to be rethought. The idea that the middle-class and the young will always be the most stalwart supporters of democracy is also looking increasingly rocky.

The erosion of democratic values in the west was outlined last year in a much-discussed article by the academics Roberto Foa and Yascha Mounk, writing before the election of Donald Trump. The article highlighted the rise of anti-democratic sentiments in both the US and Europe. One of their more eye-catching points is that one-in-six Americans now think that it would be a good idea for the “army to rule” — up from one in 16 in 1995. And while more than 70 per cent of Americans born in the 1930s think it “essential” to live in a democracy, only 30 per cent of those born in the 1980s agree. There has been a similar, if less marked, decline in faith in democratic institutions in Europe. Mr Foa and Mr Mounk conclude that “over the last three decades, trust in political institutions such as parliament or the courts has precipitously declined across the established democracies of North America and Western Europe”.

Mr Foa and Mr Mounk concentrate on the west. But the revival of soft authoritarianism is even more visible in countries that were once symbols of the democratic wave, such as the Philippines, which overthrew the Marcos regime in 1986, Russia, where Communist party rule ended in 1991, and South Africa, which ended apartheid in 1994. All three countries have retained key elements of democracy, such as elections. But they have seen an erosion of democratic norms and an embrace of personalised rule, which has allowed corruption to flourish.

In Russia, the economic collapse and lawlessness of the 1990s created the conditions for a revival of autocracy under Vladimir Putin. The Russian president has created a template for a soft authoritarianism combining nationalism, populism, corruption, a crackdown on the media and a close alliance between the presidency and a wealthy oligarchy. It may be no accident that some of the most articulate warnings against Trumpism have been issued by Russian dissidents, such as Garry Kasparov and Masha Gessen.

Rodrigo Duterte, the strongman president of the Philippines, has borrowed liberally from the Putin playbook. His embrace of vigilante justice has appalled Filipino liberals but has played well with a public that is frightened by crime and drugs. Mr Duterte also did well with young voters, who have few memories of the struggle to establish democracy in the Philippines.

The same pattern is threatening South Africa. The presidency of Jacob Zuma has seen a surge in corruption and growing pressure on the media and independent branches of government. Many liberal South Africans hope that the end of the Zuma years will see a democratic revival. But things could go the other way. Simon Freemantle, senior political economist with Standard Bank, warns that “South Africa’s Trump moment is brewing”. He points to surveys showing that South Africa’s “born free” generation, born after the release of Nelson Mandela in 1990, are less supportive of democracy than people with memories of the struggle against apartheid. There is also growing support in South Africa for a Trump-like deportation of illegal immigrants.

What is it that links the erosion of support for democracy in countries as diverse as Russia, the Philippines, South Africa and even the US? It is that for many voters democracy is a means to an end, not an end in itself. If a democratic system fails to deliver jobs, as in South Africa, or security, as in the Philippines, or is associated with a stagnation in living standards, as in the US, then some voters will be attracted to the authoritarian alternative. A drift towards authoritarianism will become more likely, in the context of rising inequality, when the political and economic system seems “rigged” in favour of insiders.

Of course, there will always be people who see political freedom as a value in itself — something that is indispensable to human dignity. But dissidents prepared to go to jail in support of free speech are relatively rare. Ronald Reagan, the US president who saw out the last years of the cold war, liked to boast that “freedom works”. Unfortunately, if ordinary people stop believing that, some may give up on freedom.

cheadline: 大学生村官政策的成就与反思
clongleadbody: 何国俊、王绍达：大学生村官被称作“新上山下乡运动”，这一政策对中国农村的发展起到了怎样的作用？
cbody:
过去十年，在中央“一村一个大学生”的号召下，中国各地政府选聘大量大学毕业生到农村任职。他们主要担任村主任助理、村支书助理等职位，俗称“大学生村官”。一方面，政府希望通过这一政策培养出一批了解国情、熟悉基层的基层官员，另一方面，政府也希望大学毕业生能够利用自己的文化知识提升基层治理水平、帮助村民脱贫致富。这一政策规模浩大：迄今为止全国累计选聘了超过五十万名大学生村官，并有超过二十万村官正在农村任职，覆盖全国三分之一的行政村，各级财政每年需要为这项政策支出数十亿元。

这项被称作“新上山下乡运动”的政策究竟对农村发展起到了怎样的作用，媒体与学术界争议不断。一方面，类似“优秀大学生村官成功创业、带动经济发展”的案例时常见诸媒体，另一方面，“大学生村官不接地气、难以扎根基层”等批评也非偶然现象。关于这一政策的媒体报道和由此引发的大量讨论，往往都基于评论者的主观印象或者偶然观察，难以形成共识性结论。

因此，基于田野调查和科学方法的定量研究，对于评估、调整和改进大学生村官政策有重要现实意义。在即将发表于《美国经济杂志：应用经济学》的一篇论文中，笔者对中国的大学生村官项目做了系统化评估，全面分析了这一政策对农村社会经济发展的影响。

大学生村官会帮助贫困户领取补贴

中国的扶贫工作在过去的三十多年里取得了举世公认的辉煌成就。但是，长期以来，贫困居民底数不清、扶贫政策针对性不强、扶贫资金指向不准甚至被滥用等问题也广泛存在。我们看到，“人情扶贫”、“关系扶贫”常常见诸报端，从而造成“应扶未扶”、“扶富不扶穷” 等社会不公现象的产生。因此，扶贫是大学生村官政策的主要目标之一。

我们的研究发现，大学生村官会广泛参与到农村政策的宣传与执行中，从而改善国家各项扶贫政策的执行效果，使得更多符合条件的贫困家庭享受国家提供的福利补贴和保障政策。很多大学生村官会通过调查、访谈等形式去了解贫困居民的家庭情况，协助他们申请相应的政策补助，有效的提高了扶贫政策的针对性和准确性。计量结果表明，在其它条件不变的情况下，大学生村官的工作可以使得享受各项补贴的村民比例提高约21%，使得享受危房改造政策的村民比例提高约14%。

大学生村官抑制扶贫领域腐败

中央的扶贫资金经过各级政府层层下达后，落实最终还是要靠最基层的官员。然而，一些基层官员利用职务之便，通过虚报冒领、克扣私分、优亲厚友等方式，截留、挤占、挪用、拖欠、套取、骗取扶贫物资和资金，造成性质恶劣的的“扶贫腐败”。据最高人民检察院通报，涉农扶贫领域职务犯罪的特点之一就是这种“小官涉贪”明显。一些省份村“两委”负责人案件超过了整个涉农扶贫领域职务犯罪的半数，有的市县更是高达70%至80% 。

因此，我们进一步研究了大学生村官的出现是否会抑制扶贫过程中的腐败。我们发现， 在同一省份家庭条件相同的情况下（按照政策理应获得同样数额的补贴），在有大学生村官的行政村中，村民实际拿到手的补贴数额高出近40%。这样的结果说明，由于大学生村官来自外部并相对独立于村里的大家族和利益团体，他们的存在对基层干部的腐败行为起到一定的制约作用，从而使得类似克扣补贴金额、按照人际关系发放低保等不公平现象相对减少。

大学生村官与农村经济发展

除了宣传落实扶贫政策外，大学生村官同时肩负着促进经济发展、繁荣农村市场经济、推广科技文化、加强基层组织等职责。例如，据媒体报道，截至2014年，全国大学生村官共创办创业项目近17000个，领办合办合作社4293个，为农民群众提供就业岗位22万多个。

鉴于此，我们也研究了大学生村官项目是否真的对农民增收、提高农业生产率等方面产生了影响。

然而遗憾的是，我们并未发现大学生村官在这些方面发挥了作用：有大学生村官的村子和没有大学生村官的村子相比，其农民人均纯收入以及农民收入结构并没有显著区别。此外，村集体企业经营状况、村财政收支等其他方面也没有因为大学生村官的加入而发生变化。因此，媒体宣传报道的关于“大学生村官带领村民致富”的先进事迹可能只是个别现象，对全国而言并不具有足够的代表性。

资料及数据来源

上述结论来自于我们历时四年所搜集的大量定性和定量的资料。这些资料主要来自于三个方面。第一个是案例研究。在一个地级市市政府的支持下，我们深度访谈了当地数十位大学生村官，并收集了当地的大学生村官绩效考核表、村官民情笔记等等定性资料。第二个是我们参与的一个具有全国代表性的抽样调查。2015年，民政部对全国1500个行政村进行了一次村级治理问卷调查，我们参与设计了其中与大学生村官有关的部分，并分析了搜集到的数据。

第三个数据是长期追踪调查。我们从农业部获取了涵盖全国随机抽样的两百五十个村、跨越十一年的详细追踪调查数据，并在有关部门的支持下回顾调查了这些村子里大学生村官任职信息。定性的资料让我们了解到了大学生村官的具体职责、工作以及各个利益相关方对该政策的认识和评价，定量的数据则用来比较有大学生村官和没有大学生村官的村子在该政策执行前后各项经济指标是否发生了显著的变化，让我们能够系统的对大学生村官政策进行了评估。

大学生村官政策的反思及改进空间

总的来说，我们的研究表明，大学生村官的出现对中央扶贫政策的宣传落实、抑制扶贫腐败方面起到了十分积极的作用。然而，这一政策在促进农村生产力提高，增加农民收入等方面用处不大。

我们认为，现有的政策至少可以从以下几方面改进：第一，应该更加科学地将大学生村官和农村匹配，做到用人所长。在我们的的调查中，很多大学生村官都反应，大学所学知识与农村发展不匹配，导致“知识用不到对的地方”，人力资本的利用程度低。第二，大学生村官的绩效考核方式应该优化。目前很多地区的大学生村官绩效考核主要集中在扶贫这一项上，这很可能是造成大学生村官未在其他方面（尤其是农村经济发展）发挥更广泛作用的原因之一。

第三，大学生村官的考核评价结果应该和他们未来的职业发展挂钩，建议以村官任内的表现作为能否转正成为正式公务员的依据，促使他们有更大的动力去为农村服务。第四，大学生村官被乡镇政府借调的情况比较普遍，且大多数是去充当书记员、会计的角色。这导致相当比例的大学生村官并不能很好的了解农村、为农村服务，有悖该政策的初衷。

第五，政府应该考虑为大学生村官的创业尝试提供系统性的支持，对有潜力的项目进行适当资助和风险分担。我们在调研中发现，很多大学生村官都有诸如“引进新技术”、“做培训和继续教育”、“联网把产品卖到更大的市场”等想法，却因为缺少配套的资金和制度安排而无法实施。

最后，可以考虑让大学生村官群体广泛的参与到“精准扶贫”的工作中来。由于大学生村官在“精准扶贫”所要求的 “精确识别”、“精确帮扶”、“精确管理”等方面有巨大优势，他们的参与将显著的提高“精准扶贫”有效性和可实施性。

cheadline: 中国证监会再融资新政抑制企业过度筹资
clongleadbody: FT分析显示，受最新出台的再融资新政影响，至少180家中国上市公司将被迫取消或缩减配股计划。
cbody:
至少180家中国上市公司将被迫取消或缩减总价值达到970亿美元的配股计划，原因是官方出台了新规，抑制为了有问题的收购和金融投机而进行的过度筹资。

这些规则出台之际，中国监管机构越来越关注“脱实入虚”的趋势——这一短语用于表述那些放弃实体经济活动，转向资金运作的公司。2016年，上市公司向被动金融产品投资了创纪录的1100亿美元，即便固定资产投资增速是自1999年以来最慢的。

中国证券监管机构上周五发布新规，限制通过非公开发行进行二次股票发行。除了金融产品外，这类股票发售大部分被用于私人股权收购，而投资目标的选择标准是匹配散户投资者追捧的投资“概念”，哪怕这意味着投资目标在收购方的核心业务以外。

就像公司更名以发出启动战略转变、进军高科技等时髦业务的信号，从而提振股价那样，收购的目的是吸引投机者的兴趣。

“公司管理层利用二级非公开发行作为把低品质资产证券化、从而套取现金的一种方式。结果是小投资者被套牢，”交银国际(Bocom International)在香港的研究部负责人洪灝表示。

通过上市公司发行股票以收购非上市公司的战略，在中国尤其具有吸引力，因为政府严格控制首次公开发行(IPO)的数量，许多公司要等候多年才能获准上市。非公开发行是首选方法，因为规则允许新股定价低于当前市场价值。

去年，793家上海和深圳上市公司通过非公开发行募集资金1.8万亿元人民币（合2610亿美元）。同时，根据万得资讯(Wind Information)的数据，这两家交易所的227笔IPO交易募资总额只有1500亿元人民币。

最新规则规定，申请非公开发行股票的，拟发行的股份数量不得超过本次发行前总股本的20%。若前次募集资金到位尚不到18个月，上市公司不得进行非公开发行。同时，已经持有“较大”现金余额或其他金融资产的非金融企业，不得申请非公开发行股票。

英国《金融时报》对万得数据进行的分析表明，约178家上市公司已经披露的非公开发行计划（估计总价值6680亿元人民币）似乎会违反上述三条规定中的前两条。

抑制由二次股票发行助燃的金融投机，符合中国今年遏制金融风险的整体焦点。中国央行近几个月指导货币市场利率走高，以求化解债券泡沫。

最新规则还与政府的中期目标有联系，即逐步取消IPO审批要求，允许市场决定哪些公司可以发售新股，以及它们何时和以什么价格出售新股。

中国证券监督管理委员会(CSRC)近几个月显著加快了IPO审批步伐。分析师们表示，该机构打算首先缩短IPO排队行列（目前有619家公司排队），然后解除对IPO流程的管制。中国证监会主席刘士余本月曾表示，他预计需要两、三年才能处理完现有的IPO申请。

相对强劲的市场缓解了这样一种担忧，即IPO活动加快将分流对现有股票的需求。但分析师们表示，收紧二次发行在一定程度上就是为了从整体上再平衡股票筹资，使其向IPO倾斜，同时保持对总量的控制。

“过去两年非公开发行募资规模庞大，增长速度非常快，”西南证券(Southwest Securities)在上海的策略分析师朱斌表示。“对资本市场整体的‘抽血’影响是毁灭性的。”

eheadline: Rules threaten $100bn worth of China share sales
ebody:
At least 180 Chinese listed companies will be forced to cancel or scale back planned rights offerings worth $97bn in response to regulations that target excessive fundraising used for dubious acquisitions and financial speculation.

The rules come as Chinese regulators are increasingly concerned about the trend of “exit the real, enter the fake” — a phrase used to denote companies abandoning real economic activity in favour of financial engineering. Listed companies invested a record $110bn into passive financial products in 2016 even as fixed-asset investment grew at its slowest pace since 1999. 

China’s securities regulator on Friday issued regulations that restrict the use of secondary share offerings through private placements. In addition to financial products, such share sales have largely been used to fund private-equity acquisitions, with investment targets chosen to match investment “concepts” popular with retail investors, even when the target is outside the acquirer's core business. 

Much like company name changes designed to pump up share prices by signalling a strategy shift to trendy businesses such as technology, the acquisitions are intended to attract interest from speculators.

“The secondary private placement has been used by company management as a way to securitise low quality assets so as to cash out. Small investors have been left holding the bag,” said Hong Hao, head of research at Bocom International in Hong Kong. 

The strategy of raising shares through listed companies to acquire unlisted ones is especially attractive in China, where the government tightly controls the flow of initial public offerings, and many companies have waited years for approval. Private placements were the preferred method because the rules allow pricing new shares below their current market value. 

Last year, 793 Shanghai and Shenzhen-listed companies raised Rmb1.8tn ($261bn) through private placements. Meanwhile, the 227 IPOs in those two exchanges were worth only Rmb150bn, according to data from Wind Information.

The latest rules state that the amount of shares issued through private placements cannot exceed 20 per cent of previously outstanding shares. Companies will not be allowed to conduct private placements if they have already completed a placement within the past 18 months. And non-financial companies that already have “rather large” cash balances or other financial asset holdings will not be allowed to place shares. 

Some 178 listed companies have disclosed private placement plans worth an estimated Rmb668bn that appear to run afoul of the first two provisions, according to an FT analysis of Wind data. 

The move to curb financial speculation fuelled by secondary share listings is in line with China’s broader focus on curbing financial risks this year. The central bank has guided money-market interest rates higher in recent months in an effort to deflate a bond bubble. 

The latest rules are also linked to the government’s medium-term goal of phasing out the approval requirements for IPOs and allowing the market to decide which companies can sell new shares, when they sell and at what price. 

The China Securities Regulatory Commission has noticeably increased the pace of IPO approvals in recent months. Analysts say that the agency intends to first reduce the IPO queue, which stands at 619 companies, before deregulating the IPO process. CSRC chairman Liu Shiyu said this month that he anticipated it would take two to three years to go through the latest IPO applicants. 

A relatively strong market has eased fears that increased IPO activity will siphon demand from existing shares. But analysts say tightening secondary offerings is in part an effort to rebalance overall equity fundraising towards IPOs while keeping overall volumes in check. 

“The scale of private placements over the past two years has been enormous, and growth has been very fast,” said Zhu Bin, tactical analyst at Southwest Securities in Shanghai. “The ‘bloodsucking’ impact on the overall capital markets has been devastating.”

cheadline: 万达收购美国制片公司交易遇阻
clongleadbody: 知情人士称，万达10亿美元收购迪克克拉克制片公司的交易，因中国政府方面的监管因素被推迟。
cbody:
由亚洲首富之一领导的中国综合企业集团大连万达(Dalian Wanda)似乎难以完成以10亿美元收购迪克克拉克制片公司(Dick Clark Productions)的交易。有迹象显示，中国的监管打压正在波及国内一些人脉最深厚的集团。

两名熟悉该交易的知情人士表示，万达收购金球奖(Golden Globe Awards)背后的美国制片公司的高调计划遭遇了监管障碍——这一障碍影响了试图收购海外资产的很多中国企业。

二人表示，来自监管部门的批准被推迟了，但并未被拒绝。

一名了解万达面临的法律困境的知情人士表示，中国政府试图遏制资本外逃的各种限制，直接影响到万达完成交易的能力。

在中国企业在化工、金融、体育和娱乐行业进行了18个月的疯狂海外交易后，去年12月中国监管机构表示将监控“非理性的”海外投资。

汤森路透(Thomson Reuters)的数据显示，2016年以海航集团(HNA Group)和万达为首的中国企业达成的海外收购交易总额达2204亿美元，占全球跨国收购活动约16%。

好莱坞电影制片商是试图把美国电影制片引入快速增长且渴求内容的国内市场的中国企业追逐的目标。去年万达以35亿美元收购了传奇娱乐(Legendary Entertainment)，此前在2012年还收购了美国电影院线AMC。

一位知情人士称，随着中国监管机构试图阻止他们认为具有投机性或重点是向海外转移资金的海外收购，收购进程延迟是近几个月常见的事。

万达拒绝就此事置评。

自去年11月以来，中国外汇监管机构和商务部(Ministry of Commerce)警告银行称，企业收购其主营业务以外资产的收购可能被否决。12月，中国商务部明确表示，将监控与房地产和娱乐业相关的交易。

作为中国最大的商业地产开发商，万达多年来一直在进行其房地产核心业务以外的多元化经营。亿万富翁王健林旗下的这家综合企业最近也在关注欧洲银行业。上周，英国《金融时报》报道了万达与德意志银行(Deutsche Bank)旗下的德国邮政银行(Postbank)进行非正式接触一事。万达否认有这回事。

万达以及其他一些与中国政府关系密切的综合企业，此前被视为不受新规则约束的例外。熟悉该公司的银行人士表示，他们预计万达将继续考虑海外交易。

译者/马柯斯
eheadline: Chinese regulators hold up Dalian Wanda’s Dick Clark deal
ebody:
Dalian Wanda, the Chinese conglomerate led by one of Asia’s richest men, is struggling to complete its $1bn buyout of Dick Clark Productions as a regulatory clampdown in China shows signs of hitting even some of the country’s best-connected groups.

The high-profile acquisition of the US production company behind the Golden Globe Awards had run into a regulatory snag afflicting many of the Chinese companies trying to buy assets overseas, said two people with knowledge of the deal.

Approval from regulators had been delayed but not denied, both people said.

Chinese authorities are trying to curb capital flight with restrictions that are directly affecting Wanda’s ability to close the deal, said a person informed about the legal difficulties facing the company.

After a spree of overseas deals in the past 18 months in the chemical, financial, sports and entertainment sectors by Chinese companies, Beijing regulators said in December they would be monitoring “irrational” overseas investments.

Chinese groups — led by conglomerate HNA Group and Wanda — agreed $220.4bn in acquisitions or about 16 per cent of global cross-border activity, in 2016, according to data from Thomson Reuters.

Hollywood movie makers have been a prime target for Chinese groups seeking to bring the magic of US film making to their fast-growing and content-hungry domestic market. Wanda acquired Legendary Entertainment for $3.5bn last year and AMC movie theatres in 2012.

One of the people said a delay in this process was commonplace in recent months, as China’s regulators attempt to hold back outbound acquisitions they deem speculative or focused on moving cash overseas.

Wanda declined to comment on the matter.

Since November, China’s foreign exchange watchdog and its Ministry of Commerce have warned banks that acquisitions in which companies scoop up assets outside their primary business could get blocked. The Ministry of Commerce in December said explicitly that it would monitor property and entertainment-related deals.

Wanda, China’s largest commercial property developer, has been diversifying from its core real estate business for years. The conglomerate, owned by billionaire Wang Jianlin, has also eyed European banks recently. The Financial Times reported last week that Wanda had unofficially approached Deutsche Bank’s Postbank. The company denied that.

Wanda and a handful of other conglomerates with close connections to the Chinese government have been viewed as an exception to the new rules. Bankers familiar with the company have said they expect it to continue to consider outbound transactions.

cheadline: 世行：政治变数危及贸易增长
clongleadbody: 世界银行最新报告称，政治不确定性正在拖累贸易增长，特朗普及保护主义的崛起已经给全球经济蒙上阴影。
cbody:
世界银行(World Bank)的一份报告得出结论称，政治不确定性正在减缓贸易增长，这说明唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)的崛起可能已经在给全球经济蒙上阴影。

国际货币基金组织(IMF)、经合组织(OECD)和世行等主要国际机构最近上调了它们对全球经济增长的预测，主要是由于各方预期减税、基础设施支出增加和一波放松管制将提振新总统上任后的美国经济。

但世行经济学家周二发布的报告突显出，贸易这个历史上重要的全球增长引擎之一处于脆弱状态。

这项研究没有对特朗普点名，但指出了不断升温的保护主义和撕毁贸易协定的威胁——正是美国总统发出了这些威胁。

它还提出这样一个可能性，即特朗普政府迫使企业将全球供应链迁回美国的企图，可能破坏提振疲弱的生产率增长的努力。

国际贸易增长在过去五年一直低于历史趋势线。根据世行团队的数据，2016年录得的1.9%增长，是自全球金融危机爆发后、2009年商贸活动崩盘以来最慢的。

该团队发现，影响发达经济体和发展中经济体的贸易增长乏力，有一部分可归因于整体趋势，例如世界各地经济增长缓慢和大宗商品价格崩盘。

但2016年的主要变化是围绕经济政策的不确定性飙升。根据世行的计算，2015年至2016年贸易增幅下降0.8个百分点中的0.6个百分点是这种不确定性所致。

世行团队的计算依据是针对18个国家30年期间贸易与经济政策不确定性之间关系的一项研究。他们补充说，他们预计这种影响将在2017年延续。

“在政策不确定性仍将很高的情况下，我们可以继续预期（全球）贸易增长乏力，”研究报告的作者之一米凯莱•鲁塔(Michele Ruta)表示。

世行团队还寻求量化贸易协定对全球贸易增长的影响。根据他们的计算，1995年至2014年期间，世界贸易年增长率达到6.53%。他们发现，如果没有新成员（包括中国）加入世界贸易组织(WTO)或者没有签署新的贸易协定，同期国际贸易每年只会增长4.76%。

近几十年贸易协定爆炸性增加的一大后果是全球供应链的形成。这类供应链被经济学家们广泛视为让企业更有效率，提高了生产率。

但是特朗普和他领导的行政当局已表态称，他们希望打散那些国际供应链，使相关活动迁回美国本土。

“只把总装厂留在国内，在那里组装以外国组件为主的‘美国’产品，对美国经济没有长期好处，”总统的顶级贸易顾问之一彼得•纳瓦罗(Peter Navarro)上月对英国《金融时报》表示。

根据世行团队的说法，这种举措，加上解除那些推动建立了国际供应链的现有贸易协定，将会损害生产率增长。

“保持和扩大贸易协定的范围，而不是从现有的承诺后退，将有助于保持生产率增长，”世行经济学家们写道。

译者/和风
eheadline: Policy uncertainty threatens trade growth, says World Bank
ebody:
Political uncertainty is slowing trade growth, a World Bank report has concluded, indicating that the rise of Donald Trump may already be casting a shadow over the global economy.

Major international institutions such as the IMF, the OECD and World Bank have recently upgraded their forecasts of global economic growth largely due to expectations that tax cuts, rising infrastructure spending and a wave of deregulation will boost the US economy under the new president. 

But the report by World Bank economists, released on Tuesday, highlights the fragile state of one historically important engine of global growth — trade. 

The study avoids naming Mr Trump, but highlights rising protectionism and threats to unwind trade agreements — such as those made by the president.

It also raises the prospect that attempts by the Trump administration to force companies to repatriate global supply chains to the US could undermine efforts to boost lagging productivity growth.

International trade has been growing below historic trends for the past five years. The 1.9 per cent growth recorded in 2016, according to the team at the bank, was the slowest since the 2009 collapse in commerce that followed the global financial crisis. 

The team found that some of the reasons for the anaemic trade growth, which affected both developed and developing economies, were broader trends such as slow economic growth around the world and a collapse in commodity prices. 

But in 2016 the principal change was a surge in uncertainty about economic policy. According to the World Bank’s calculations, such uncertainty was responsible for 0.6 percentage points of the 0.8 percentage-point fall in trade growth between 2015 and 2016. 

The team at the bank based their figure on a study of the relationship between trade and economic policy uncertainty in 18 countries over three decades. They added they expected the impact to continue in 2017. 

“To the extent that the policy uncertainty will remain high we should continue to expect [global] trade growth to be subdued,” said Michele Ruta, one of the authors. 

The World Bank team also sought to quantify the impact of trade agreements on global trade growth. World trade grew at an annual rate of 6.53 per cent between 1995 and 2014, they calculated. Had no new members — including China — joined the World Trade Organisation or no new trade agreements been signed, international trade would have grown at just 4.76 per cent annually, they found.

One of the big consequences of the explosion in trade deals in recent decades has been the emergence of global supply chains. Such chains are widely seen by economists to have made businesses more efficient and boosted productivity. 

But Mr Trump and his administration have said they want to unwind those international supply chains and bring them home. 

“It does the American economy no long-term good to only keep the big box factories where we are now assembling ‘American’ products that are composed primarily of foreign components,” Peter Navarro, one of the president’s top trade advisers, told the Financial Times last month. 

According to the World Bank team such a move, coupled with unwinding existing trade agreements that have encouraged the establishment of international supply chains, would hurt productivity growth. 

“Preserving and expanding the reach of trade agreements, rather than backtracking on existing commitments, would help to sustain the growth of productivity,” the bank’s economists wrote.

clongleadbody: IMF高官利普顿称，对于特朗普有关贸易不公的抱怨，美国的经济伙伴国应认真对待，并解决其中合理的诉求。
cbody:
国际货币基金组织(IMF)敦促德国和其他欧洲国家设法找到与唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)“进行建设性接触”的途径，尽管美国总统可能对开放市场、多边贸易、甚至IMF自身的角色构成威胁。

IMF第一副总裁戴维•利普顿(David Lipton)周二在柏林表示，美国的经济伙伴国应该认真对待特朗普对世界贸易体系的所谓不公平之处的抱怨，并解决那些美方诉求或许合理的问题。

“努力提前思考如何更有建设性地与美国打交道，是合情合理的，”利普顿说。他督促20国集团(G20)轮值主席国德国采取行动。

“我认为，我们的目的是，在美国的主张有道理的地方努力帮助他们找到补救措施，并以合作方式实现这一点。我认为，G20在某种意义上（提供了）合适的政治领导。”

David Lipton, the IMF’s first

“It makes sense to try to think

“I think it is our aim to try to

help the US

find remedy where we see there is merit in their argument and to do so through

the co-operative process. I think the G20 [offers], in a sense, the right

political leadership.”

cheadline: 美国加大力度管控非法移民
clongleadbody: 国土安全部启动墨西哥边界的建墙计划，扩招1万名移民官员，新增5000名边界保护局官员，并扩充移民法官编制。
cbody:
美国国土安全部(DHS)周二发布了关于边境安全和遣返非法移民的大量新规则，这是美国总统唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)承诺的打击非法移民努力的一部分。

在两份备忘录中，国土安全部部长约翰•凯利(John Kelly)详细介绍了“旨在遏止非法移民和便于对非法进入或滞留在美国的外国人实施侦查、逮捕、拘留和移除”的步骤。

凯利指示下属开始规划沿墨西哥边界建造一堵墙；雇用1万名新的移民官员，外加5000名新增的边界保护局官员；以及“大幅增加移民法官和避难受理官员的部署”。

这些举动延续了特朗普的快速努力，目的是展示其在兑现竞选承诺方面取得早期进展。这些承诺去年帮助他当选。

这些措施标志着告别奥巴马政府对待非法移民的政策——即优先移除被判犯有重罪的外国人。根据备忘录，特朗普将驱逐被判或被指控“有任何刑事犯罪行为”的外国人，或在政府机构面前有过任何虚假陈述（包括滥用公共福利）的外国人。

“对于可移除的外国人类别，我部将不再免除可能的执法，”凯利在备忘录中写道。

在推进雇用数千名新增边界保护局官员的同时，国土安全部还将恢复奥巴马政府不再重点强调的一项政策——委派地方执法官员处理移民事务。备忘录称，在近10年时间里，该计划已识别了超过40.2万符合遣返条件的个人。

译者/何黎
eheadline: US ramps up crackdown on illegal immigrants
ebody:
The US Department of Homeland

Security on Tuesday issued sweeping new rules for border security and

deportations as part of President

Donald Trump’s promised

crackdown on illegal immigration.

In a pair of memorandums, homeland

security secretary John Kelly detailed steps

“designed to stem illegal immigration and facilitate the detection,

apprehension, detention and removal of aliens who have no lawful basis to enter

or remain in the United

States”. 

Mr Kelly directed subordinates to start planning construction of a wall

along the border with Mexico;

hire 10,000 new immigration agents plus 5,000 additional border control

officers; and “surge the deployment of immigration judges and asylum

officers”. 

The moves continue Mr Trump’s breakneck effort to demonstrate early progress

towards fulfilling the campaign promises that fuelled his election

victory. 

The announced measures represent a break with the Obama administration’s

approach to illegal immigration, which prioritised the removal of aliens convicted

of serious crimes. Mr Trump instead will expel aliens convicted or charged with

“any criminal offence” or those engaged in any misrepresentation before a

government agency, including the abuse of public benefits, according to the

memos. 

“The department no longer will

exempt classes or categories of removable aliens from potential enforcement,”

Mr Kelly wrote. 

While proceeding with the hiring

of thousands of additional border agents, the DHS will also resume a policy

that the Obama administration had de-emphasised of deputising local law

enforcement officers to handle immigration matters. Over an almost 10-year

period, that programme had identified more than 402,000 individuals eligible

for deportation, the document said.

cheadline: 优步遭遇“管理路障”
clongleadbody: 希尔：快速成长的公司都会经历一个时刻：从野蛮发展向正规管理转型。有时这种变化需要一场危机来推动。
cbody:
当优步(Uber)创始人特拉维斯•卡兰尼克(Travis Kalanick)去年欢迎阿里安娜•赫芬顿(Arianna Huffington)加入这个打车公司的董事会时，他夸赞了她的“情商”，并让大家关注她那本关于睡眠的畅销书。未来几周赫芬顿可能要动用不少情商，而难以获得很多睡眠时间。

在优步一名前工程师对这家公司提出性骚扰指控后，卡兰尼克决定由她负责，对此事展开“一场完全独立的调查”。

苏珊•福勒(Susan Fowler)发表了一篇长文，讲述优步人力资源团队如何忽视她被上司性骚扰的投诉。日前卡兰尼克就此在Twitter上表示：“她描述的经历很可恶，而且与我们秉持的一切理念相悖。”

福勒在文中写到，通过公司聊天系统发送的一些消息“明显放肆”，于是她立即向人力资源部门报告。她声称人力资源和“高层管理人员”承认这些消息相当于性骚扰，但令她不舒服的是相关人员“只受到警告和严肃约谈”，因为这是他的“初犯”，而且他“是一个绩效很高的职员”。后来福勒称，她发现这名管理人员此前也被其他女性投诉过。福勒在文中写道，她在2016年12月离开了优步，当时她所在部门的女性比例已从25%下降到2%，而该部门“处于完全的、无可救药的混乱状态”。

混乱堪称许多科技初创企业的运营原则——想想Facebook早期座右铭“行动敏捷，打破传统”(move fast and break things)就会明白。由男性工程师主导的文化也是此类企业的特色，而这种文化偶尔会带来性别歧视行为（甚至更糟）的指控。

真正令人意外的是这一爆炸性的组合没有更频繁地爆炸。福勒对此给出了解释。她和其她女性当初坚持待在优步，尽管——在一定程度上是因为——有这种乱糟糟的环境。她写道：“虽然环境混乱，但我们埋头做事，完成了一些（有时候相当出色的）工作。我们喜欢自己的工作，我们喜欢工程技术挑战，我们喜欢让优步这架疯狂机器运转起来。”

所有快速成长的公司都经历过这样一个时刻：它们必须开始对一家之前依靠自律的小公司进行更加正规的管控。有时这种日益成熟的第一个迹象就是任命一名人力资源官员。但有时需要一场危机来改变行为。去年，医疗保险中介公司Zenefits松懈的企业文化引起了监管机构的注意，而其新任首席执行官承认“在合规方面，我们许多内部流程、控制和行动存在不足”。

随着优步加速扩张，它陷入了各种各样的争议，比如最近纽约出租车司机因特朗普政府的旅行禁令举行罢工，优步与用户就该公司的反应发生了争执。卡兰尼克在努力修补那场争吵导致的声誉损害时表示：“我们一贯相信要站在正义的一边。”福勒对优步的描述似乎表明，这家公司以如此迅猛的速度成长，以至于其人力资源团队和管理人员忽视了卡兰尼克所说的基本宗旨。考虑到这些指控对其他员工和用户具有潜在连锁效应，卡兰尼克将需要赫芬顿调动一切情商来避免一场“车祸”。

译者/蓝田
eheadline: Claims of chaos and macho culture put Uber on collision course
ebody:
When Uber’s founder Travis Kalanick welcomed Arianna Huffington to the ride-hailing company’s board last year, he lauded her “emotional intelligence” and drew attention to her bestseller about sleep. Ms Huffington can expect to have to use a lot of the former and get much less of the latter in the coming weeks.

She is the Uber director tapped by Mr Kalanick to conduct “a full independent investigation” into allegations of sexual harassment levelled at the company by a former engineer.

“What’s described here is abhorrent & against everything we believe in”, tweeted Mr Kalanick on Sunday about Susan Fowler’s long account of how Uber’s human resources team ignored her complaints about sexual advances from her manager.

Ms Fowler writes that messages sent over a company chat system were “so clearly out of line” that she reported them to HR immediately. She claims HR and “upper management” acknowledged the messages amounted to sexual harassment, but did not “feel comfortable giving him anything other than a warning and stern talking-to” because it was his “first offence” and he “was a high performer”. Later, Ms Fowler claims she found out other women had previously made complaints against the same manager. She left the company in December 2016, by which point, she writes, the proportion of women in her part of the organisation had dropped from 25 to 2 per cent, and the unit was “in complete, unrelenting chaos”.

Chaos is an operating principle of many technology start-ups (think of Facebook’s early “move fast and break things” motto). So is a culture dominated by male engineers — and with it come occasional allegations of sexist behaviour, and worse.

It seems surprising this potent mix does not explode more often. Ms Fowler explains why it does not. She and others persisted at Uber despite — and in part because of — the messy environment. “We kept our heads down and did good (sometimes great) work despite the chaos,” she writes. “We loved our work, we loved the engineering challenges, we loved making this crazy Uber machine work.”

All fast-growing companies experience a moment when they have to start imposing more formal controls on what was previously a small, self-regulating group. Sometimes the first sign of this growing maturity is the appointment of an HR officer. But sometimes, it takes a crisis to change behaviour. Last year, lax culture at Zenefits, a health insurance brokerage, drew the attention of regulators and an admission from its new chief executive that “many of our internal processes, controls, and actions around compliance have been inadequate”.

As Uber has raced to expand, it has run into a variety of controversies, including, most recently, a row with users over how the company reacted to the New York taxi drivers’ strike over the Trump administration’s travel ban. “We’ve always believed in standing up for what’s right,” Mr Kalanick said, in seeking to repair the reputational damage from that spat. Ms Fowler’s description of Uber suggests the company has grown at such breakneck speed that even that basic tenet was neglected by its HR team and managers. Given the potential knock-on effect of these allegations on other employees and on users, Mr Kalanick will need all Ms Huffington’s emotional intelligence to avoid a car crash.

cheadline: 金正男之死的启示
clongleadbody: 曹辛：金正男被暗杀，反映了当前中国在朝鲜半岛面临的严峻现实。中国对朝鲜要有个符合当前实际的基本战略。
cbody:
“有道理，也很有意思。”

“如果他在韩国，他有可能避免这样的悲剧。”

“但是韩国没有责任”、“你们应该谴责朝鲜的恶性！”

在笔者在指出金正男的死因可能是受到韩国策反，欲流亡韩国而不能见容于金正恩时，一位韩国外交权威人士这样回答笔者。他对笔者的怀疑没有否定，也没有肯定。

马方证据对朝鲜不利

对朝鲜来说，假如有人要流亡韩国，和流亡其他地方的性质是完全不一样的，是地地道道的“叛徒”。

早在金日成时代，朝鲜高级干部流亡国外就不是新鲜事，关键要看在什么地方流亡，中国、俄罗斯可以得到默认，韩国则绝对不行。前朝鲜驻苏联大使、朝鲜军事停战委员会中朝首席代表李相朝就曾经因为卷入劳动党内斗争，长期拒绝从莫斯科奉召回国，还受到苏联的保护，也都相安无事。可是他后来流亡韩国，便立即被金日成怒斥为“叛徒！”

2月18号，朝鲜官方首次就此事发声：朝鲜驻当地大使表示，坚决不承认尸检的结论。问题是：马来西亚当时还没有公布尸检结论，怎么就不承认呢？朝鲜同时要求马来西亚引渡金正男尸体给朝鲜。

而韩国则在阻挠此事，先是要求案件结束后才引渡尸体，随后金正男的第二任夫人要求引渡尸体给家属，韩国又要求马来西亚政府同意。

朝鲜引渡尸体的目的可能是想尽快销毁，以免给人利用，而韩国则可能是想利用尸体做公关文章，可能的话，再看看马来西亚有什么尸检方面的遗漏之处。朝韩双方已经展开秘密外交战。

2月19日，马来西亚警方召开记者会。据马方介绍: 暗杀金正男共有11人涉案，已逮捕四人，七人在逃；在逃七人中有五人持朝鲜护照，被捕四人中，也有一人持朝鲜护照。马国警方已通过国际刑警组织，对上述在逃的朝鲜人士发出通缉令。

所有不利的证据，都在指向朝鲜。

2月20日，马来西亚召回驻平壤大使，并向朝鲜驻马来西亚大使抗议。2月20号当晚，据传金正南儿子赴马来西亚，履行认尸的相关法律手续。

金正男被暗杀说明了什么？

我们首先来看看金正男这个人存在本身的政治功能是什么。作为朝鲜建国领导人金日成的长孙，金正男流亡海外这一事实本身，就是对那个打着社会主义旗号而实际奉行领导人世袭制的国家制度的一种控诉，金正男本人本身就是最生动的活教材。而且，他还经常发表谈话，批评朝鲜的世袭制，称赞中国的改革开放政策。

最重要的是：他实际上还是个储君。他曾任朝鲜人民军大将、海外保卫总局局长、公共安全部部长。他的任职部门和经历使得他实际上具有相对开阔的国际视野，也具备相当的行政能力。还有，他是朝鲜开国领导人金日成的长孙。这一系列的身份使他和“满洲国”建国之前的溥仪一样，一旦朝鲜国内局势有变，他随时可以被利用来替代金正恩。

金正男被暗杀的事实，反映了当前中国在朝鲜半岛面临的严峻现实。

从韩国方面来说，李明博时代就开始计划策反金正南去韩国了。据2月19日新加坡《联合早报》报道，一位李明博时代的高官透露：五年前李明博政府就试图策反金正男了，只是因为当时他孩子在外国上学，家人还在中国生活，所以遭到金正男拒绝。

这说明，韩国有意争夺未来朝鲜半岛统一的主导权。而且韩国的统一意愿已经急不可待。据韩方人士介绍，朴槿惠2015年参加中国“九·三”阅兵时就对此很关心，现在韩国的执政者则更是想借朝鲜国际孤立之际，加速这一进程。而作为美国的盟国，一旦由韩国而不是联合国或者国际社会主导、实际操作半岛的统一，未来中国在半岛的安全局势将变得非常不确定。

而对于朝鲜来说，马来西亚警方目前的调查结果，尤其是国际刑警组织的介入，朝鲜实际上已经变成金正男被害案的嫌疑人。如果真是这样，朝鲜已经罔顾中国外交尊严，决心和中国撕破脸了。因为金正男及其夫人和子女这么多年来是生活在中国的澳门和北京的，其安全当然也是由中国保护的，朝鲜的行为实际上是对中国的公开羞辱。

可能也正因为如此，据传朝鲜上周派高官崔龙海访华。一位韩国政府权威人士向笔者分析说：“一定是为了正男”，来说明情况、道歉来了。这一趋势应该引起中国的高度警惕。

怎么办？

就当前朝鲜半岛南北双方的情况来看，应当“丢掉幻想，准备斗争”。对朝鲜这个国家来说，无论是它强烈的拥核意志、还是蓄意通过炫耀核武力和导弹，把对中国不友好的军事力量吸引到中国周边，乃至使朝鲜半岛纳入美国全球反导系统，都是对中国国家安全利益的直接、严重的危害。尤其是在2016年这一年，朝鲜的核试验和导弹发射已经达到疯狂的地步。在中国南海问题局势最严峻的时刻，朝鲜仍然我行我素，全然不顾这个国家离开中国将无法生存这一基本事实，完全罔顾中国的国家安全利益。

中国对朝鲜要有个符合当前实际的基本战略。这个战略诚如笔者以前文章所言，应该是通过换人、驻军，实现朝鲜的弃核、改革开放（见笔者《掌控朝鲜：中国需在东北亚争取主动》,FT中文网2016年9月13日）。为达这一目的，可以动用一切手段。这既是中国自己的安全利益需要，也是朝鲜人民的利益所系。

就当前来说，可以先实施对朝鲜断油、断粮；废除两国互免签证协议，让中国境内除学生和外交官以外的一切朝鲜公民立即回国，到平壤的中国大使馆重新申领来华签证。

在国际上，中国可以和美国、韩国合作，把朝鲜脱北者问题拿到联合国层面解决，吁请联合国难民署承认朝鲜脱北者的难民身份，一旦难民问题出现，立即按照国际法原则和韩国法律遣返韩国，从而从根本上解决朝鲜难民可能蜂拥来华这个可能的不确定前景。

为实现上述目的，中共中央可以党内文件的形式向全党做一个说明，说清楚金正恩上台以来朝鲜劳动党的行为及其对中国党和国家的严重危害，从而彻底统一党内对这个问题的认识。

对韩国，中国同样应有行动。一是要坚决坚持中国政府对“萨德”问题的立场，并应准备有效手段加以应对。同时对来华从事对朝策反、传教的人员进行限制，尤其是要禁止他们在中朝边境地区的不正常活动。一经发现，立即处罚、驱逐。对朝方在华有关人员，尤其是在延边和丹东地区的同类有关人员，也一律照此办理。必须确立这样一个原则：中国不是朝韩隐蔽战的战场。

在上述半岛南北双方中，朝鲜问题是当前的重点，应该首先着力解决。

（注：本文仅代表作者个人观点。责编邮箱bo.liu@ftchinese.com）

cheadline: 分析：特朗普在Twitter上的“中国帖子”
clongleadbody: 如果把特朗普谈论中国的帖子浓缩成一个主题，立场其实相当稳定：全球秩序已变化，美国到底做了什么准备？
cbody:
没有人会否认美国总统唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)对社交媒体Twitter情有独钟。不论在选前或就职后，他的每一篇帖子牵动著全球局势，各家新闻媒体因为他的推文而疲于奔命，虽然他已有美国总统专属帐号 @POTUS，但特朗普仍不动于衷，勤于通过私人帐号 @realDonalTrump 畅所欲言。

2009年3月，特朗普首度登上Twitter舞台。至今3千多个日子过去，发出帖子3万则以上（不包含被删除的推文）、追随者超过2500万名。狂妄、自负、口无遮拦，是大部分观察家阅读特朗普私人帐号的共同感受。但如果仔细分析近8年来的内容，事实上能找出规律和可预测性。

如果把特朗普最常在Twitter“挂上嘴边”的国家进行排名，不意外的，特朗普最关心美国，截至2月20日，至少发出3165则推文提及美国（ America, United States, USA）或美国人（American）。而排名在美国之后的国家，依序为中国、伊朗、伊拉克、俄罗斯。

通过谈论中国攻击奥巴马政府

虽然身为特朗普在推特上特别关心的外国国家，特朗普谈起中国却是攻击力道毫不手软。

曾有美国数据科学家分析特朗普Twitter帐号，发现特朗普会交叉使用iPhone、安卓、桌机发文，如果是通过安卓手机推文，多半是特朗普亲自操刀而非助理代笔，且用字遣词相对愤怒，大量使用疯狂(crazy)、软弱(weak)等负面形容词。如果说特朗普谈论中国的帖子，使用安卓手机发送的数量是iPhone的近30倍，似乎已预告特朗普谈论中国的起点。

从2011年1月首次提到中国、计算到今年2月20日，特朗普至少有464则发文提到“中国 (China) ”或“中国人 (Chinese) ”。这当中有95％的内容明显透露出敌意，而其余5%的正面或无特别情绪内容，则多半希望拿中国案例来攻击奥巴马领导无方。如果交叉比对特朗普历年推文以及特别谈到中国的内容，能发现奥巴马的名字高频率地出现在与中国相关的帖子中。

另外，如果仔细看特朗普历年发出的帖子，出乎意料的，他关心中国话题的时间并不是在去年美国大选期间，而是高度集中在2011年，之后，中国话题占整体发文的比例开始逐年下滑。

有意思的是，长达7年在Twitter上谈论中国，特朗普的观察重点和立场并没有太大变化。从特朗普最早提到中国的发文就能看出端倪。

谈论中国的主轴：经济

2011年7月特朗普第二次在Twitter上提起中国：“奥巴马每花1美元，等于我们要让子孙向中国连本带利借贷1.4美元。削减——上限——平衡！（表示支持共和党提出的削减赤字行动）”（截屏来自Twitter官网）

2011年，美国爆发债务上限危机，面对中国政府成为美国国债最大持有人，特朗普不满现状，认为中国在贸易和汇率上“不按照规矩”，开始在Twitter上大量评论中国。上面这条推文（见上图），事实上也预告了特朗普在推特上谈及中国的主旋律：经济。

在特朗普提到中国的话题中，有将近一半的内容是关于中美贸易之差、中国在全球的能源布局、人民币汇率或是美国就业率等经济议题，近两成的内容则涉及国防军事和国家安全，剩下的推文，则多半是特朗普希望通过中国经济情势向民主党或奥巴马政府开炮、又或是吹捧自己对政经情势的先见之明。

如果把特朗普谈论中国的帖子浓缩成一个主题，他的立场其实相当稳定，在过去7年不断通过Twitter诉说：全球秩序已变化，美国到底做了什么准备？有趣的是，特朗普甚至会在Twitter上反覆使用“China is laughing at us ”（中国在嘲笑我们）等嘲讽语句（见下图），间接表示对美国现状的愤怒。

长期抱持这样的立场，也不意外特朗普会于2016年总统大选期间会高举竞选口号“Make America Great Again (让美国再次复兴） ”，或是自2011年起，特朗普因为出版新书《Time To Get Gough》（是时候该强硬起来）而开始在Twitter上大量使用标签 “#TimeToGetGough”抨击时事。

面对外界好奇，特朗普政府将如何布局全球贸易、还有会如何与中国政府交手？特朗普在2011年的一则推文或许能透露他的态度和底线：“我相当尊重(respect)中国的代表。但我不认可我们（指美国）对中国在谈判及交易上的方法。”但问题是，什么是特朗普倾向的手段和方法？最坏的情况可能是如同特朗普的推文风格，不缺立场和口号，但实际作法，随兴吧。

（作者邮箱：silva.shih@ftchinese.com）

cheadline: 特朗普如何唤醒一代人的政治意识
clongleadbody: 邰蒂：特朗普的上任让美国宪法和民主本质成为了全民热议的话题，连我13岁的女儿都加入了这场“政治觉醒”。
cbody:
上个月初，我的大女儿宣布，她想参加1月21日的华盛顿妇女游行(WMW)。我惊呆了。迄今为止，我13岁的女儿的生活——和Instagram动态——一直充斥着家庭作业、各种爱好、YouTube明星、衣服和连连爆发的中学生友谊风波。这没什么好惊讶的：在她这个年龄的时候，在伦敦长大的我关注的也是类似的事情。但我从未有过游行的念头——在玛格丽特•撒切尔(Margaret Thatcher)的时代，伦敦郊区中产阶级家庭的孩子不会做这种事情。

2017年的美国是一个神奇的地方。自从去年大选转为唇枪舌剑以来，我的女儿们就被政治辩论迷住了。这或许归因于她们有一个从事媒体工作的母亲；另一方面，我女儿想去参加游行的一个原因是她在中学里的朋友们也打算参加。

尽管人们很容易轻视这种突如其来的政治积极性，认为这不过是一种青少年时尚，这种现象的确反映出一股更广泛的趋势。无论是好是坏，特朗普就任总统在美国引发了一场针对政府和民主本质的令人惊异的新辩论。事实上，当未来的历史学家回顾当前这场纷乱的争论，他们可能得出结论：2016-17年间发生的最重要的事件之一，是新一代西方人拥有了政治意识——或者至少对政治不那么满不在乎了。

对美国青少年而言，特朗普在妇女权利和移民问题上的立场是引发这种觉醒的主要原因。毕竟，政府在这些问题上的政策会影响数百万人的日常生活，从那些在“计划生育”（Planned Parenthood，一个提供医疗服务和开展性教育的组织——译者注）旗下诊所寻求建议的人，到那些试图更新绿卡的勤奋的移民。要理解这些问题或者在Twitter上发表相关意见很容易；试着看看蕾哈娜(Rihanna)等明星的社交媒体动态，或者《青少年时尚》(Teen Vogue)等杂志最近开辟的言辞犀利的政治专栏吧。

但特朗普还做到了一些更让人惊讶的事情：他让美国宪法的复杂性成为了当前备受关注的辩论话题。直到最近，许多美国人（更不必说非美国人）不曾花费很多时间来思考美国宪法的条款和修正案；我怀疑特朗普本人在竞选总统前对宪法细节也不是很了解。

但随着白宫打击移民的惊人戏码逐渐上演，这提供了一堂有关总统权力界限的实时课程。在特朗普接受有关政府运作机制的辅导的同时，美国公众也经历了类似的受教之旅。“制衡”的概念不再像是某种只在学校考试中出现的东西，而是成为晨间电视节目激烈讨论的话题。

因此，难怪本月早些时候“ninth circuit”（美国联邦第九巡回上诉法院(Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals)的简称）成为最热门搜索词之一，甚至排在“乐高蝙蝠侠大电影”(The Lego Batman Movie)之前。难怪去年一种52页的美国宪法口袋本（此前一名穆斯林演讲者在民主党全国大会上挥舞过一本宪法小册子）进入畅销书榜单。也难怪美国公民自由联盟(American Civil Liberties Union)在大选后获得了8000万美元的捐款（其中有2400万美元是在特朗普下达行政命令后的2天内捐献的）。难怪ProPublica等调查性新闻机构得到了源源不断的支持。难怪自选举日以来逾4000名女性告诉民主党团体她们想要竞选公职（其中包括1月20日以后提出申请的1660名女性）——是前22个月的申请者数量总和的4倍。

一些人可能会主张，这种公民意识——和公众监督——之前没有爆发，令人扼腕叹息。他们可能还会质疑这种觉醒是否能转化为理智的行动。不管怎样，今天的青少年和成年人需要了解，民主不仅需要人们参加游行、发Twitter帖子，也需要人们参与和监督政府程序。愤怒指责白宫的行动是一回事儿，但现在迫切需要选民（和记者）去做的，是以同样的热情监督国会和司法机构的运作，更不必说游说者的行动。一条Twitter帖子无法轻易地抓住这些问题。

但尽管我（作为一名记者）领了薪水来做一个怀疑者，而且（作为一个人）因为种族主义的崛起等一些黑暗的政治趋势而感到恐惧，我也萌生了一股乐观情绪。事实上，由于复杂的国内交通情况，我的女儿并没有和她的朋友们一起参加那次妇女游行。但尽管如此，她正在密切关注新闻，而且，从Instagram动态来看，她的朋友们也是如此。或许这只是成长过程中的一个阶段，但或许她这一代人将不像他们的父母那样对民主满不在乎。这么想令人心情愉悦。

译者/徐行
ebody:
Early last month, my eldest daughter declared that she wanted to go on the Women’s March in Washington DC on January 21. I was stunned. At the age of 13, my daughter’s life — and Instagram feed — has hitherto been filled with homework, hobbies, YouTube stars, clothes and the never-ending friendship dramas that erupt in middle school. No surprise there: when I was that age, growing up in London, my mind was filled with similar preoccupations. But it would never have occurred to me to go marching — in the era of Margaret Thatcher, suburban middle-class kids did not do that sort of thing.

America in 2017 is an extraordinary place. Ever since the election campaign exploded into acrimony last year, my daughters have become fascinated by political debate. This might be attributed to the fact that they have a mother who works in the media; on the other hand, one reason my daughter wanted to go on the march was because her middle-school buddies were heading there too.

While it might be easy to dismiss this sudden political activism as little more than a teenage fad, it does illustrate a broader trend. For better or worse, Trump’s presidency has unleashed a startling new debate in the US about the nature of government and democracy. Indeed, when future historians look back through the current cacophony, they may conclude that one of the most important things to have happened in 2016 and 2017 was that a new generation of westerners became politically aware — or, at least, less complacent.

For American teenagers, Trump’s stances on women’s rights and immigration have sparked much of this awakening. Government policy on these subjects, after all, affects millions of people in their everyday life, from those seeking advice at Planned Parenthood clinics to hardworking immigrants attempting to get their green cards renewed. These issues can also be easily grasped and tweeted about; try taking a look at the social-media feed of stars like Rihanna or the sharp political columns that have recently appeared in magazines such as Teen Vogue.

But Trump has also done something more surprising: he has made the intricacies of the US constitution a live topic of debate. Until recently, many Americans (not to mention non-Americans) did not spend too much time pondering its articles and amendments; I doubt whether Trump himself knew that much about the finer details of constitutional law before he ran for office.

But as the extraordinary drama around the White House’s immigration clampdown has unfolded, it has created a real-time lesson on the limits of presidential power. As Trump has undergone a tutorial in how government works, the American public has been on a similar educational journey. The concept of “checks and balances” no longer looks like something merely found in a school exam but, instead, is being breathlessly discussed on breakfast television.

It is little wonder, then, that the phrase “ninth circuit” was one of the top trending online searches earlier this month, above even “The Lego Batman Movie”. Nor that a 52-page pocket version of the US constitution hit the literary bestseller list last year (after a Muslim speaker waved the booklet at the Democratic National Convention). Nor should it be any surprise that the American Civil Liberties Union has received $80m of donations since the election (including $24m in the two days after Trump’s executive order). Nor that investigative journalist bodies such as ProPublica have enjoyed a deluge of support. Nor that more than 4,000 women have told Democratic groups since election day that they want to run for office (including 1,660 since January 20) — that is four times higher than applicants in the previous 22 months combined.

Some might argue that it is a profound pity that this civic awareness — and public scrutiny — did not erupt before. They might also question whether this awakening can ever translate into sensible action. Somehow, today’s teenagers and adults need to learn that democracy requires people to not just march and tweet but also volunteer, participate and oversee government processes. It is one thing to squeal with fury about the actions of the White House but what is badly needed now is for voters (and journalists) to exercise a similarly passionate scrutiny over the operations of Congress and the judiciary, not to mention the lobbyists. Those issues cannot be captured quite so easily in a tweet.

But while I (as a journalist) am paid to be a cynic, and (as a human) feel horrified by some of the dark political trends, such as rising racism, I feel a flash of optimism as well. As it happened, my daughter never joined her friends on that Women’s March, due to complex domestic logistics. But in spite of that, she is closely watching the news and, judging from Instagram, so are her friends. Maybe this is just a phase, or maybe her generation will be less complacent about democracy than their parents were. It would be nice to think so.

clongleadbody: 窦文宇：节日是营销行业从业者做内容的绝好时机，但不少企业的节日内容营销缺乏思路、主题，沦于平庸。
cbody:
情人节喧嚣刚刚散去，做内容赶热点的营销人终于喘了口气。圈内流传一个段子：小编在情人节那天抱怨，我一个单身狗，却偏偏被分配写“情人节攻略”的推送，简直是虐心啊！其实，玩笑之外，企业内容营销，举目四望，的确找不到可供从业人员参考的节日内容指南，现有的一些案例及观察也比较零散，缺乏系统化的梳理与总结。

本文从社会心理学角度，分析节日（如情人节， 春节， 圣诞节等）对于人类社会活动及心理的影响，提出一个系统性的节日内容营销框架。读完本文，相信你的节日内容营销将可以花样缤纷，如虎添翼。

社会心理学框架中，节日（Holidays）指的是人们生活中的特定日子，用于纪念特别的事件（如国庆），历史典故（如端午），或者人物角色（如母亲节）。每个节日通常都会有其特定含义（核心主题）——如情人节，是男女之间爱情；伴随着共同认可的仪式(rituals)——如情人节的送花、烛光晚宴等；明确的符号（symbols）——如情人节的玫瑰、心型、粉色等。而且还有可能牵涉到延展节日含义：比如在国外，情人节虽然主要是男女之爱，但也逐渐扩展到广义的“爱”，比如亲人、朋友，及其他利益相关者（对企业，可能指客户）之间的关爱。

从核心主题、仪式、符号到延展主题，人们对节日精神的诠释逐渐放宽，但大致上依然保持了对节日的敬意。但是，还记得几天前情人节铺天盖地的秀恩爱中，不甘寂寞的“单身狗”各种聒噪吧？的确，虽然节日有社会主流习惯认可的庆祝方式。但人及社会都有复杂多样性， 社会心理学中的抵触理论 （Resistance Theory）认为，社会中的部分群体，可能因为种种不同原因，展现出与他人（如主流群体）在理念或行为上的差异：在节日场景下，他们或者规避节日庆祝，或者以与主流不一致的形式（anti-establishment），宣示自己对节日的独特理解与感受。

综合以上分析，本文提出一个关于节日内容营销的框架，它涵盖了节日的主要元素，及相应的可能内容主题。

提出框架，固然是把节日内容营销知识系统化的重要一步，但这个框架在内容营销实战中是否适用，应该是企业及从业者关心的问题。为此，本文特意做了一个探索性的实证研究，来考察这个框架在节日内容营销的前沿主战场的适用状况。

具体怎么做的？写起来有点学术味，如果你准备读营销硕博，那你应该读完，而其他人，或可选择“此处省略…字”，直接跳到下一段。

研究场景选取的是刚刚过去的2017年情人节的社交媒体上的内容营销。

中国社交媒体：从2017年1月新浪微博企业官V排行榜中，选取了前10家品牌（账号）作为研究样本，排名从1 到10，分别是：OPPO，网易阴阳师手游，魅族科技，完美女人CChannel，网易云音乐，支付宝，天猫，彩妆资讯羊咩咩，英雄联盟，Vivo智能手机。

国际社交媒体：研究样本为eConsultancy (2016) 发布的全球30家具有优秀社交媒体营销战略的品牌。包括Fortune 500公司，如General Electric，Coca-Cola，Nike，也包括新晋品牌如Net-A-Porter，Paddy Power，Innocent Drinks等。

对每个中国品牌，选取其官方微博在2月14日发布的帖子，其中每个品牌都发布了至少一条关于情人节的内容。一天内发布帖子多于一个的则重点研究其营销内容最具体的那个（如，纯粹促销的不考虑），对每个帖子的内容进行图文分析，总结出内容要素。

对每个国际品牌，调研其官方主要社交媒体账号(Facebook,，Twitter， Instagram)，2月14日发布的帖子，重点研究其营销内容最具体的帖子，通过图文分析总结出内容要素。在30个品牌中，约有一半没有发布与情人节专门相关的帖子，在剩余的15个中，为与中国样本品牌数相匹配，选取了10个情人节内容较为突出的国际品牌。

我们发现：首先， 与核心节日主题（Core Holiday Concept）直接相关的帖子：

没有情人的情人节？那是不可想象的！@网易阴阳师手游 推出的狮系男友，拥有子安武人的华丽声线 (what does that mean?) 妖娆的身姿，性感而残酷——绝对诱惑！

L’ OReal Make Up： 代言美妆博主Simply Sona说，To my sweetheart ——你知道我在等你吗？

@魅族： 一个长长的女孩单相思故事——凄凄切切，结尾却峰回路转，引出魅族品牌！—— 爱，可以疯狂；植入，却不动声色。

其次，与节日仪式 (Rituals) 相关的帖子：

@完美女人CChannel ——情人节，吃的也要甜甜蜜蜜，一起欢享巧克力棉花糖吧！

Taco Bell – 情人节男友该送女朋友什么？当然是玫瑰！但也别忘了捎上可口的Taco哟——这才是最佳男友(a keeper)。

当然，如果你实在粗心忘事，情人节啥也没买，马上就要见女朋友， 怎么办? 开通支付宝亲密付吧，就可以马上转钱给她！——马云叔叔只能帮你到这了。

在情人节这个特别日子，情侣在一起总得做点值得纪念回味的事吧。如家？ 有点俗！@天猫 ：我想和你一起看日出——这才是一起庆祝情人节的高雅姿势!

天高，云淡， 蓝天， 碧海——情人节也是情侣度假的一个绝佳时机，Airbnb 告诉你墨西哥的Puerto Vallarta及南非的开普敦海滩是情人节度假的热门订房场所，let’s go!

瓜熟蒂落，情到浓时，共同走入婚姻殿堂是个完美结局——在国外，情人节也是情侣选择结婚的一个高峰日子。做Pizza的Domino’ s趁机插话：情人节婚礼，要图个乐呵，怎能少了美味pizza？

再次，与节日符号 (Symbols) 相关的帖子：

翱翔蓝天，穿越心型云朵(heart-shaped cloud)的荷兰航空 （KLM）

呆萌的泰迪熊，满屏的粉红心——@彩妆资讯羊咩咩翱翔蓝天 温馨提示，给女朋友送化妆品的时候到了！

@网易云音乐 远看是品牌logo ——可仔细一看，背景好像有点污——不解释了，反正不管你怎么认为， 网易云音乐的商标符号已经妥妥曝光了，偷着乐！

这个浪漫的节日，到处可见两个紧紧相拥的背影——甜蜜，让人有点嫉妒！ Coke-Cola也来秀一把，两个依偎的可乐瓶！——为了幸福， 干杯！

烈焰，红唇——就让L’ Oreal Make Up照亮你的2月14——男朋友？Optional!

最后，与延展节日主题 (Extended Holiday Concept) 相关的帖子：

Lowe’ s Home Improvement: 孩童眼中的爱，天真而宽泛——爱父母， 爱老师， 爱同学——只要心中有爱，家就是温暖的港湾——让Lowe’s 家居产品点亮每一个家庭！

General Electric的工程师，虽不乏人类之爱，但更动人的可能是他们对科学的热爱——这也是多年来GE创新不断的源泉。情人节，莫忘记为知识之爱喝彩！

Innocent Drinks: 爱，不仅仅在情侣亲人之间，办公室同事之间也可以有——不过，别指望亲密， 或许只是调侃呢！

情人节那浓得化不开的氛围中，除了玫瑰，心型，粉色等视觉元素之外，一些简单的文字可能已经会让人心跳——如love，hottie——有机食品餐厅Pret-A-Manger用上这些词，再配上火热的符号——这款饮料，就是情人的热饮！

此外，与反主流(Anti-establishment) 相关的帖子：

情人节是个两极分化严重的节日，有幸福的情侣瞄，也有悻悻的单身汪——@OPPO 谁都不得罪，两个阵营上传OPPO R9s 拍的照片——看看这天谁能笑到最后，赢得奖品！

相比之下，@VIVO 就直接很多，“执子之手更出色，一起撒狗粮”——这还让单身狗怎么活呀！不过，用Vivo晒幸福更加畅快的卖点——你get到了吗？

谁说情人节只能玫瑰传情，烛光晚餐，浪漫出行？偏不！我要..打..游...戏！@英雄联盟 决定在男女玩家中促成10段情缘——还送奖品，10万点券。做什么？让你们配对之后接着玩游戏呀！

综上所述，节日是营销业者做内容的好时机。但不少公司的节日内容营销缺乏明晰的思路、主题，沦于平庸。要么就是缺乏变化，趋于雷同。从社会心理学角度，本文通过理论分析提出了一个完整的节日内容营销框架——包含核心主题，仪式，符号，延展主题及反主流共5个维度。此框架在实证研究中得到支持。企业的节日内容营销可以依照这个指南，按方抓药，通过聚焦不同维度去诠释品牌眼中的节日，达到理想的节日内容营销效果。

（作者系香港城市大学商学院副院长，EMBA(中文)课程主任。本文仅代表作者观点。责任编辑邮箱：tao.feng@ftchinese.com）

cheadline: 阿里安娜•赫芬顿的睡眠革命
clongleadbody: 库柏：赫芬顿善于把握时代大势中的商机。在《赫芬顿邮报》的成功之后，她创立了健康公司，“出售”睡眠。
cbody:
我第一眼看到阿里安娜•赫芬顿(Arianna Huffington)时，一名年轻的助理正站在她身边举着一只小型手电，使自己的老板在光线很暗的房间中仍然可以作笔记。赫芬顿正在修改她将在约翰内斯堡的“发现领导力峰会”(Discovery Leadership Summit)上发表的演讲稿，主要内容是关于睡眠（有益）和智能手机（不那么有益）。睡眠是她开拓的新商业领域。这相对于打造传媒公司《赫芬顿邮报》(The Huffington Post)而言似乎是一个很大的跳跃，但这当中有模式可循。赫芬顿的卓越才能在于把握时代特征，并将其货币化。

在她开口说话的那一刻，她的希腊口音会吓你一跳。你永远也猜不到，16岁的赫芬顿离开雅典的小公寓来到英国已经是半个世纪以前的事。（她后来又从英国到美国。）她对参会人士说，“这个口音曾是我生活的苦恼之源，直到有一天我遇见了亨利•基辛格(Henry Kissinger)，他对我说，‘你永远不会低估完全不可理解在美国公共生活中所能产生的影响。’”

但当我们随后一起坐下聊天——在我抵抗住了她让我谈论自己而不是她的富有魅力的尝试后——赫芬顿解释称身为希腊人其实是一种商业优势。“也许作为一个外来者，我对于打破常规毫无压力。我丝毫都不固守现有的做事方式。”

对于她“扰乱”的第一个目标——媒体——而言，她具备极其有利的条件。一个显著优势是，她很有钱：1997年，她与德克萨斯石油业亿万富翁迈克尔•赫芬顿(Michael Huffington)友好离婚，因为此人对她声称自己是双性恋。作为一名写过很多书的作者，她运用自己的人际交往能力与半个美国文化圈的精英们交上了朋友。（她曾被称为“自伊卡洛斯(Icarus)之后最善于向上流动的希腊人”。）而她比几乎所有人都更早地预见到，未来大多没有报酬的写手们能够创造出新的在线传媒品牌。2005年她创立了《赫芬顿邮报》。她招揽来为其撰写博客的朋友包括诺拉•埃夫龙(Nora Ephron)和诺曼•梅勒(Norman Mailer)。2011年美国在线(AOL)以3.15亿美元的价格收购了该网站。据称赫芬顿净赚2100万美元，并留任编辑职务。

当唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)开始竞选美国总统时，《赫芬顿邮报》最初仅在娱乐版块报道他的竞选活动。后来该报给每则关于特朗普的报道都附上一篇“编者按”，称特朗普是“一个惯性撒谎者，嚣张的仇外者，种族歧视者，厌恶女性者，以及出生地阴谋论者”。但当我问到特朗普的胜利是否让她感到惊讶时，赫芬顿表示并没有。她向我指了指她出版于2010年的书《第三世界的美国》(Third World America)。“这本书讲的是美国很多地方已经变成第三世界的现实。给特朗普投票的正是这些地方的人。”

2016年，或许是因为她又比大多数人更早地意识到了新闻业的无意义，赫芬顿从传媒跳到了睡眠领域。她自己在2007年以前一直是一个几乎不睡觉的高成就者，直到她最后崩溃，醒来发现自己躺在一滩血中，颧骨骨折。她改变了自己的睡眠习惯，将电子设备从卧室中移了出去，并将睡眠时间重新定义为一个放松心情的阶段。现在她践行的日常仪式包括泡热水澡，以及每晚写下一份“感谢清单”来放下白天的“所有问题以及未完成的事务”。

她过了一段时间以后才发现，睡眠是一个商业机会。2014年，她出版了《茁壮成长》(Thrive)一书。在四处推广该书时，“我发现，睡眠是人们最想和我讨论的话题，超过书中的任何其他内容。（赫芬顿罕见地既能倾听他人发言，也能侃侃而谈。）因此她写了《睡眠革命》(The Sleep Revolution)一书，并于近期创立了自己的“健康公司”Thrive Global。该公司业务模式的核心即是销售睡眠。

我猜这是一个好主意。我们中的绝大多数人都很疲惫。据哈佛大学医学院(Harvard Medical School)的查尔斯•切斯勒(Charles Czeisler)估计，在过去的五十年间，美国人在工作日夜晚的平均睡眠时长从八个半小时缩短到了七小时。睡觉时把智能手机放在身边，就像很多人现在所做的那样，无助于增进睡眠。

这个问题无疑在特朗普身上得到了体现，他宣称每晚只睡四个小时。赫芬顿称，特朗普表现出了睡眠不足的典型特征：冲动，偏执，以及无法处理信息。“他需要更多睡眠，”赫芬顿说，“而且他需要把手机放在卧室以外的房间充电，以保证他半夜醒来不会在推特上回复墨索里尼或者攻击前环球小姐。”

赫芬顿补充称，如今越来越多的人意识到他们有睡眠问题。她打了一个不甚恰当的比喻：“一场集体性的觉醒正在发生。”就连高盛(Goldman Sachs)和麦肯锡(McKinsey)都开始聘用睡眠专家。

赫芬顿在某些方面仍然是一个记者——正是靠着这一点她能够敏锐地嗅出时代趋势——在我快要结束采访的时候，她开始采访我的睡眠习惯。我承认自己感到疲惫。

四个星期以后，我发现赫芬顿已经改变了我的生活。在库柏家，现在睡觉时间就意味着睡觉时间：一个放下白天纷扰的阶段。我自己做不到写“感谢清单”，但我已经停止了在床上阅读与工作有关的材料，并且睡觉时不再把智能手机放在身边。如今我确实感到没有那么疲惫了。我或许会作为一个早期皈依者被载入史册。

译者/马拉
ebody:
When I first spot Arianna Huffington, a young aide is standing beside her holding a pen flashlight so that the boss can make notes in a darkened room. Huffington is fine-tuning her speech for the Discovery Leadership Summit in Johannesburg, about sleep (good) and smartphones (not so good). Sleep is her new business. It seems quite a leap from building the Huffington Post media company, and yet there’s a pattern here. Huffington’s gift is for spotting the zeitgeist, then monetising it.

The moment she opens her mouth, her Greek accent startles you. You’d never guess that it’s half a century since the 16-year-old raised in a small Athenian flat arrived in England. (She later upgraded to the US.) The accent, she tells the conference, “has been the bane of my existence, until one day I met Henry Kissinger and he said, ‘You can never underestimate the effect in American public life of complete and utter incomprehensibility.’”

Yet when we sit down later — and after I have fended off her charming attempt to talk about me instead of her — Huffington explains that being Greek is a business asset. “Maybe being an outsider, I’m comfortable disrupting conventional ways of being. I don’t have any allegiance to the current way of doing things.”

She was perfectly placed to disrupt her first target, the media. Handily, she had money: in 1997 she amicably divorced the Texan oil billionaire Michael Huffington, after he told her he was bisexual. An author of many books, she had used her people skills to befriend half the American cultural elite. (She has been called “the most upwardly mobile Greek since Icarus”.) And she foresaw, before almost anyone else, a future in which mostly unpaid writers would create new online media brands. In 2005 she founded The Huffington Post. The friends she recruited to blog for it ranged from Nora Ephron to Norman Mailer. In 2011 AOL bought the site for $315m. Huffington reportedly netted $21m, but stayed on as editor.

When Donald Trump began running for president, the Huff Post initially covered his campaign only in the entertainment section. Later it appended an editor’s note to every article about Trump, calling him “a serial liar, rampant xenophobe, racist, misogynist and birther”. But when I ask whether his victory surprised her, Huffington says no. She points me to her 2010 book, Third World America. “It’s about the fact that many parts of America have become third world. They are the people who voted for Trump.”

This year, possibly perceiving the pointlessness of journalism earlier than most, Huffington jumped from media to sleep. She herself had been a sleepless overachiever until 2007, when she collapsed and woke in a pool of blood from a broken cheekbone. She changed her sleeping habits, moving devices out of the bedroom and redefining bedtime as a phase of unwinding. Now she uses rituals such as hot baths and the writing of a nightly “gratitude list” to leave behind the day “with all of its problems and unfinished business”.

It took her a while to see that sleep was a business opportunity. In 2014 she published the book Thrive. When she went around promoting it, “I found that this [sleep] is the one thing people wanted to talk to me about more than anything else in the book.” (Huffington, unusually, can listen as well as talk.) So she wrote The Sleep Revolution and, last month, launched her “wellness company” Thrive Global. Central to its business model will be selling sleep.

I suspect this is a good idea. Most of us are tired. Charles Czeisler of Harvard Medical School estimates that average American sleep on work nights has declined over the past 50 years from eight-and-a-half hours to seven. Sleeping beside one’s smartphone, as many people now do, doesn’t help.

The problem is arguably embodied by Trump, who claims to sleep four hours a night. Huffington says he displays classic characteristics of sleep deprivation: impulsiveness, paranoia, an inability to process information. “He needs to get more sleep,” she says, “and he needs to charge his phone away from his bedroom so that he doesn’t wake up in the middle of the night and retweet Mussolini or attack the former Miss Universe.”

But now, adds Huffington, ever more people are realising they have a sleep problem. In an unfortunate choice of metaphor, she says: “There’s a collective awakening.” Even Goldman Sachs and McKinsey use sleep specialists.

Huffington remains in part a journalist — that’s how she sniffs out the zeitgeist — and the moment I finish interviewing her, she starts interviewing me about my sleep habits. I admit to feeling exhausted.

Four weeks later, I can report that Huffington has changed my life. Chez Kuper, bedtime now means bedtime: a phase of leaving the day behind. I cannot bring myself to write a “gratitude list” but I have stopped doing work-related reading in bed and no longer sleep beside my smartphone. And I do feel slightly less exhausted. I may go down in history as an early convert.

cheadline: FT社评：硅谷有责任构建性别平等的未来
clongleadbody: 女工程师揭发自己在优步受到性骚扰和不公正对待一事，突显出硅谷性别失衡问题之严重。解决这个问题需从学校教育抓起。
cbody:
硅谷(Silicon Valley)是构建未来的地方。既然如此，它就有责任确保未来不会成为上世纪50年代更便利、更互联的翻版。

数字化颠覆者们已经改变了人们工作、旅行、交流以及消遣的方式，然而，在纠正各自办公场所的性别失衡现象、从而最大化地利用人力资本方面，它们取得的成功非常有限。

本周，苏珊•福勒(Susan Fowler)发表的一篇博客文章突显了该问题的严重性。福勒是一名软件工程师，在叫车公司优步(Uber)工作一年后辞职。她声称上司对她进行了露骨的性骚扰并留下了证据。人力资源部门和管理层拒不采取实际行动，一再不诚实地应付她，实际上还因她报告了该问题而惩罚了她。福勒称，在优步，女工程师受到非常恶劣的对待，以至于在她任职期间，她所在的软件运营部门女工程师比例从25%下降到了3%。

即使她的故事不足以代表优步的整体文化，该公司也存在一些严重错误的地方。该公司初步的反应至少是恰当的。首席执行官特拉维斯•卡兰尼克(Travis Kalanick)谴责了这种行为，并启动了全面调查，由独立董事以及一家外部律所负责。希望调查将还原完整的事实并提出一套有关结构性改革的明确建议。

职场性别失衡问题不只是源于带有性别偏见的招聘行为，也未必导致女性员工受到苛待。不过，无论前因后果如何，该问题带来的损害是不可否认的：它使企业、行业以及国家失去了稀缺人才。该问题不只存在于优步。在谷歌(Google)、Facebook和Twitter等科技巨头，技术类岗位中女性的占比不足五分之一。

以个别企业的聘用和留才政策为背景来考虑，解决性别失衡问题所需采取的实际措施越来越为人们所理解。例如，企业是否以看不到应聘者性别的方式查看简历？岗位描述是否剔除了有关性别的字眼？表现出色的员工是否能在职业生涯的中期休假并在重返岗位时不被降职？

这些以及其他积极的干预措施（而不是复选框）不像计算机科学那么难。这类措施也不足以解决性别失衡问题。在美国，高中男生参加最高级计算机科学课程的可能性是女生的四倍。女性在获得计算机科学本科学位的人中占比仅为五分之一，在科学和工程类工作岗位的占比为三分之一。只要这些失衡现象依然持续，它们就会在硅谷重现。

鉴于科技行业在经济中的特殊地位以及该行业所创造的巨大财富，最出色的科技企业有责任解决自身以外的问题。

这些企业需要参与到旨在培养女性计算机科学家的招聘和培训项目中。这项工作必须从小学开始，贯穿所有环节，以致力于女性参与董事会为终点。从采矿到重工业等其他领域的企业已经朝这个方向采取了实际措施。优步、Facebook、苹果(Apple)、谷歌和其他同行，没道理不成为美国乃至全世界技术教育方面主要的资助者。

毕竟，它们将首先受益于自己在这方面的投资。

译者/何黎
eheadline: FT Leader：An equitable future can be built in Silicon Valley
ebody:
Silicon Valley is the place where the future is being built. It has a responsibility, then, to ensure that the future does not look like a more convenient and connected version of the 1950s.

The digital disrupters have transformed work, travel, communication, and relaxation. Yet they have had very modest success at maximising their use of human capital by correcting the gender imbalances in their offices.

The severity of this problem was emphasised this week in a blog post from Susan Fowler, a software engineer who worked for a year at Uber, the ride-hailing company, before quitting. She claims she was sexually harassed by her boss in an explicit, verifiable way. The human resources department and management refused to take effective action, were serially dishonest with her, and effectively punished her for bringing the issue forward. The treatment of women engineers at Uber, Ms Fowler says, was so bad that their proportion of her part of the company’s software operation fell from 25 per cent to 3 per cent during her tenure.

If her story is even remotely representative of Uber as a whole, something is deeply wrong there. The initial response of the company has at least been appropriate. Travis Kalanick, the chief executive, has condemned the behaviour and initiated a full investigation, putting it in the hands of independent directors and an outside law firm. Hopefully the investigation will return a full account of the facts and a clear set of recommendations for structural change.

Gender imbalance in the workplace does not only result from biased hiring practices and need not result in mistreatment of female employees. Whatever its causes and consequences, though, the harm it does is undeniable: it deprives companies, industries and nations of scarce talent. The problem extends far beyond Uber. At tech giants such as Google, Facebook and Twitter, less than a fifth of technical jobs are held by women.

Considered in the context of individual companies’ hiring and retention policies, the practical steps required are increasingly well understood. Are, for example, résumés reviewed in a way that makes applicants’ gender invisible? Are job descriptions scrubbed of gendered language? Is it possible for high-performing employees to take mid-career breaks and return in undiminished roles?

These and other active interventions (rather than check boxes) are not as hard as computer science. Neither will they be adequate to solve the gender imbalance problem. In the US, male high school students are four times as likely to take the most advanced computer science courses. Women also receive just a fifth of undergraduate degrees in computer science, and they make up a third of the workforce in science and engineering. As long as these imbalances persist, they will be reproduced in Silicon Valley.

Given the tech industry’s special position in the economy and the vast wealth being created there, its best companies have a responsibility to address problems beyond their own doors.

They need to be involved in recruiting and training programmes that produce female computer scientists. This must start in primary schools, and the work should end only in the boardroom. Companies in other fields, from mining to heavy industry, have taken steps in this direction. There is no reason Uber, Facebook, Apple, Google and their peers should not be the leading funders of technical education in the US and the world.

They would, after all, be the first to benefit from their investment.

clongleadbody: 曾荫权被判犯有公职人员行为失当罪，获刑20个月。香港自1997年回归以来的三位行政长官，职业生涯全都黯然收场。
cbody:
香港前特首曾荫权(Donald Tsang)被判监禁20个月。上周五，法院裁定曾荫权犯有公职人员行为失当罪。

曾荫权曾在2005年至2012年担任香港特区行政长官，他是香港因行为失当而被判监的最知名政治人士。

曾荫权获罪的原因是，他在授予一家公司广播牌照时，未披露他正与该公司股东商议向后者租赁深圳某豪华公寓。

此案的法官陈庆伟(Andrew Chan)周三上午表示，香港特首“必须是一个正直的人”，而曾荫权辜负了“香港人民和中国人民对他的信任”。

由于上周陪审团未能就曾荫权是否犯有“收受利益罪”达成多数裁定，法院将就这项罪名进行重审。

曾荫权名誉扫地再次突显出香港面临的政治困境。如今香港正在挑选下一任行政长官。

香港自1997年回归中国以来的三位行政长官，职业生涯全都黯然收场。

曾荫权的前任董建华(Tung Chee-hwa)是香港回归后的首位行政长官。2005年，因其领导力在香港和北京受到批评，董建华辞去了特首职务。

香港现任特首梁振英(CY Leung)去年出人意料地宣布不寻求连任。在他主政期间，香港出现了严重的政治分歧。

译者/何黎
eheadline: Former top Hong Kong leader sentenced to 20 months for misconduct
ebody:
Former Hong Kong leader Donald Tsang has been sentenced to 20 months imprisonment after he was convicted of misconduct in public office on Friday.

Tsang, who was chief executive of the Chinese territory from 2005 to 2012, is the most high-profile politician to be jailed for misconduct in Hong Kong.

He was found guilty of failing to disclose that he was negotiating the lease of a luxury apartment in Shenzhen, a neighbouring Chinese city, from a businessman whose company was awarded a broadcasting licence.

The judge, Justice Andrew Chan, said on Wednesday morning that the chief executive “must be a person of integrity” and that Tsang had breached “the trust placed in him by the people of Hong Kong and the people of China”.

Tsang also faces a retrial after the jury last week failed to reach a majority verdict on one count of “accepting an advantage”.

His fall from grace once again highlights the political difficulties facing Hong Kong, which is in the process of selecting its next chief executive.

All three of Hong Kong’s leaders since it was handed back to Chinese control in 1997 have seen their careers end badly.

Tsang’s predecessor Tung Chee-hwa, the territory’s first post-handover chief executive, resigned in 2005 after his leadership was criticised in Hong Kong and Beijing.

CY Leung, the current chief executive, unexpectedly announced last year that he would not seek a second term, after presiding over a period of profound political divisions.

cheadline: 中国逾一半省份报告H7N9型禽流感疫情
clongleadbody: 中国国家卫计委在会议中证实，今年1月，中国31个省份中，已有16个省份报告H7N9型禽流感感染病例和死亡病例。
cbody:
中国国家卫生和计划生育委员会（简称：国家卫计委）证实，今年1月，在中国31个省份中，已有16个省份报告H7N9型禽流感感染病例和死亡病例。

国家卫计委本周在部署全国疫情防控工作时召开了一次视频会议。该委员会证实，今年1月，中国有逾一半的省份报告H7N9型禽流感感染病例和死亡病例。

国家卫计委周二发布的会议综述称：“当前疫情可防可控，但如果不采取坚决果断措施，疫情将进一步蔓延扩散。”

国家卫计委报告，今年1月，中国内地共报告192例H7N9型禽流感感染病例，死亡79人。官方通讯社新华社上周报道的数据显示，截至2月17日，2月份共报告新增病例77例，有8人死亡。

在有关动物传播的流感的最新报告中，世界卫生组织(WHO)还指出，去年12月20日至今年1月16日，香港和澳门报告过H7N9感染病例。

H7N9型禽流感是2013年3月在中国发现的。多数的人感染病例都报告最近接触过活禽或活禽销售市场等可能受到污染的环境。销售活禽是中国南方城市的一个普遍特征。

世卫组织在1月份的报告中坚持认为，H7N9病毒和类似流感毒株带来的公共健康风险没有改变，尽管预计还会有更多人感染源自动物身上的病毒，但“这些病毒持续人际传播的可能性仍然很小”。

译者/梁艳裳
eheadline: Half of China’s provinces hit by bird flu outbreaks in January
ebody:
China’s health commission has confirmed deadly outbreaks of H7N9 avian influenza occurred in 16 of the country’s 31 provinces last month.

Confirmation that over half of China’s provinces had reported outbreaks and fatal cases of H7N9 avian influenza in January came during a conference convened this week by the National Health and Family Planning Commission on formulating a nation-wide response to the virus.

A summary of the conference published by the commission on Tuesday asserted that the situation could be contained, “but without decisive measures, the epidemic situation will spread further.”

The commission recorded 192 cases of H7N9 bird flu reported in mainland China last month, with 79 deaths. Numbers reported by state news agency Xinhua last week showed that as of February 17 there had been 77 additional cases reported this month, with eight fatalities.

In its latest report on influenza transmitted by animals, the World Health Organization also noted there had been H7N9 cases in Hong Kong and Macau during the December 20-January 16 period.

H7N9 avian influenza was first discovered in China in March 2013. Most cases of human infection report recent exposure to live poultry or possibly contaminated environments such as markets where live birds are sold – a common feature of southern Chinese cities.

The WHO maintained in its January report that public health risk from H7N9 and similar strains of influenza had not changed, and that while further human infections with viruses of animal origin are expected, “the likelihood of sustained human-to-human transmission of these viruses remains low.”
